title: herbie_(character)
body:
Herbie is the main protagonist of the franchise of the same name. He is an anthropomorphic 1963 [[Volkswagen Beetle]] racing car with a mind of his own. 
He was featured in several Disney motion pictures starting with the 1969 feature film [b]"The Love Bug"[/b].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Herbie":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbie

title: herbie_(series)
body:
The Herbie franchise is a series of films that center around [[Herbie (character)|]], a sentient anthropomorphic 1963 [[Volkswagen Beetle]] with a mind of his own. The vehicle is oftentimes a legitimate contender, though the underdog contestant in competitive races, but to a greater degree assists his human owners in bettering their lives.

There were six movies made in the following order:

[b]"The Love Bug"[/b] - released in December 24th, 1968
[b]"Herbie Rides Again"[/b] - released in June 6th, 1974
[b]"Herbie Goes to Monte Carlo"[/b] - released in June 24th, 1977
[b]"Herbie Goes Bananas"[/b] - released in June 25th, 1980
[b]"Disney's The Love Bug"[/b] - released in November 30th, 1997
[b]"Herbie: Fully Loaded"[/b] - released in June 22nd, 2005

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Herbie (franchise)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbie_(franchise)

title: dracula_flow_(meme)
body:
[b]Dracula Flow[/b] is a series of videos featuring a man crudely dressed as [[Dracula]] delivering freestyle raps. These videos were released across 2023 into 2024 on the [[YouTube]] channel PLUMMCORP RECORDS, a label associated with Joji, formerly known as [[Filthy Frank]]. 

The character of Dracula is portrayed by actor John Davis Walker, who has a history of acting in various music videos and skits.

The series gained popularity for its unconventional, bizarre and rambling freestyle rap lyrics, leading to remixes, AI voice covers, and the creation of a copypasta based on the freestyle lyrics. 

The videos have been compiled into a single collection titled "Dracula Flow: The Official Saga (1-4)," which is available on YouTube.

h4. External Links
* "YouTube - Dracula Flow: The Official Saga (1-4)":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Onr4z2fdDM
* "YouTube - Dracula Flow 5":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BmtDZPyaVpc
* "Know Your Meme: Dracula Flow":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/dracula-flow

title: metroid_(creature)
body:
Titular beastie of the [[Metroid]] video game series. Typically [[metroid larva|a floating, green, jellyfishy being with two sets of fangs and four red nuclei]]. However, this tag may also be applied to its advanced forms.

Developed on the planet Zebes, with the planet SR388 being their natural environment. Their prey ranges from just about anything that moves, but they are the only natural predator of [[X Parasite]]s.

title: nymph_(arknights)
body:
[i]The young Djall Nymph goes on an adventure for the first time.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

A compassionate Kazdelian citizen with mental Originium Arts, who recently joined the Field Operations Department through Rhodes Island's Kazdel office.

She has an older sister who work as a director of Rhodes Island's HR department.

She made a playable debut in the Story Collection event [i]A Kazdelian Rescue[/i], one of the main characters in the Integrated Strategies [i]Sarkaz's Furnaceside Fables.[/i]

Her voice actress are [[Sekine Hitomi]] (JP), Cai Na (CN), Anna Devlin (EN), and Lee Yu-ri (KR). Her illustrator is [[yuji_(fantasia)|YUJI]]

title: princess_peach_(kimono)_(club_nintendo)
body:
[[Princess Peach]] dressed in traditional [[japanese_clothes|Japanese clothing]], seen in an official calendar released by [[Nintendo]]: [i]Club Nintendo Original Calendar 2015[/i] (and 2016). This calendar was given as a reward for Club Nintendo members. This is the second time Peach has ever been depicted in a kimono in official promotional art. 

She's in a [[pink kimono|pink]] [[kimono]] that is covered in [[floral print|flower patterns]], wears a [[hirabitai]] on her head and carries a yellow [[hand fan]]. In the official art she is seen sitting on a [[hinadan]] with [[bonbori_(lighting)|bonbori]] at both of her sides.

h4. Official Art

* !asset #24571165

h4. See also

* [[Princess Peach (Kimono) (KCMEX2009)]]
* [[Princess Peach (Kimono)]]

title: princess_peach_(kimono)_(kcmex2009)
body:
[[Princess Peach]] dressed in very traditional [[japanese_clothes|Japanese clothing]], first seen during Kyoto Cross Media Experience 2009. This is the first time Peach has ever been depicted in a kimono in official promotional art. 

She's depicted in a [[pink kimono|pink]] [[kimono]] that is wrapped with a [[white sash|white]] [[obi]], and the kimono's sleeves are covered in [[floral print|floral print pattern]]. On her feet she's wearing [[pink footwear|pink]] [[okobo]] with [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]]. Her hair is done up in traditional [[nihongami]] wearing a [[tsumami kanzashi]]. She also carries a [[red umbrella|red]] [[oil-paper umbrella]].

title: quelaag's_sister
body:
A character in the video game [[Dark Souls I|Dark Souls]]. Also known as "The White Lady", "The Fair Lady", the "Daughter of Chaos", and fan-dubbed "Quelaan". A [[blind]], sickly [[white skin|white]] [[spider girl]].

One of the children of the [[Witch of Izalith]] who were transformed into demons. She relies on her sister, [[Chaos Witch Quelaag|Quelaag]], and the "Chaos Servant" covenant to feed her [[Humanity (Dark Souls)|]].

title: uberleben_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]German: "Survival"[/tn]

Real-life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Meine Theresia (racehorse)|]].  She is well known for being the winner of the 2021 Yushun Himba (The Oaks) as well as her rivalry with [[Sodashi (racehorse)|]], the first true white horse to have won a G1 race and winner of the 2021 Oka Sho (1000 Guineas).

Uberleben is a brown (read: almost black) mare with a small, white diamond-shaped "star" on her forehead and a coronet on her right back leg. In her racing prime, she was almost always seen wearing a blue hood with a white "T" on the forehead section, an item shared by many horses trained by Tezuka Takahisa (and no, the "T" is not short for "Trainer").

At the time of the 2021 Shuka Sho, the third crown race for fillies, Gallop (a horse racing magazine) played the Sodashi/Uberleben rivalry with a "White vs. Black" frontpage. However, neither won the race. [[Akaitorino Musume (racehorse)|]] (effectively "Red") became the winner of the third crown. Akaitorino Musume ("Daughter of the red bird", i.e. of Apapane) is also the reason for her strange nickname of "Shiroiare no Musume" ("Daughter of the [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|white thing]]").

She retired in March 2023 due to a bowed tendon and became a broodmare at Big Red Farm alongside her sire. After a failed attempt with Benbatl in 2024, her first child was born on February 25th 2025, a colt with a star-and-snip marking sired by [[Equinox (racehorse)|]]. Unsurprisingly, the child has the parents' shared coat color (brown) but he is also notable for his T-shaped star marking.

title: almond_eye_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Lord Kanaloa (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Fusaichi Pandora.

Almond Eye is Japan's most successful racehorse, having won 9 G1 races, breaking the 7 G1 win record held by several other racehorses, including [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]], who retired the year before she became famous and [[Vodka (racehorse)|]] with the fillies; a Triple Tiara; the world record on 2400 m (2:20.6, during the 2018 [[Japan Cup]]). She was also the leader of Japan's greatest earning racehorses, surpassing [[T.M. Opera O (racehorse)|]]'s record, until fellow-Silk Racing owned/[[Christophe Lemaire|Lemaire]] ridden [[Equinox (racehorse)|]] surpassed her at his last race at the 2023 Japan Cup.

Almond Eye is a bay mare with a star-and-snip marking and no leg markings. She usually ran with a black hood with a white shadow roll.

She had 4 foals so far, Aaron's Rod (2022, bay colt by [[Epiphaneia (racehorse)|]]), Promesa al Mundo (2023, chestnut colt by [[Maurice (racehorse)|]]), "Almond Eye's 2024" (bay filly by [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]]) and "Almond Eye's 2025" (bay colt by [[Equinox (racehorse)|]], notable for being the child of both of Silk Racing's greatest horses and for his lack of markings.)

title: princess_daisy_(hoops_3-on-3)
body:
[[Princess Daisy]] wearing her alternate attire from [[Mario Basketball 3on3|Mario Hoops 3-on-3]]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A sleeveless yellow dress with a tiered orange hem that creates a scalloped, layered look around the skirt portion. The skirt portion’s tiers transition from yellow near the top to orange at the bottom.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White ankle socks.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Orange shoes with a bright yellow toe cap.
* [b]Accessories[/b]:
** She has large, round teal ornaments—matching her classic jewelry set—on her earrings and on the brooch at the center of her dress’s neckline.
** There’s a small white ruffle collar just beneath her chin.

This outfit reappears in [[Mario Sports Mix]], [[Mario Tennis Open]], [[Mario Golf: World Tour]] and [[Mario Sports Superstars]].

title: ultra_instinct
body:
Known as [i]Migatte no Gokui[/i] in the original Japanese, it is a state of being introduced in [[Dragon Ball Super]], where its user can react without the need of acknowledging and subsequently thinking about the threat at hand - an ability so notorious for being exceptionally difficult to master that even the gods struggle to achieve it at times.

[[Son Goku]] is shown accessing the ability - first in an [[ultra instinct sign|incomplete state]] (-Sign- or -Omen-) and later in a perfected state - though not retaining it afterwards. In the former state, his body receives a blueish [[aura]] around it, his hair becomes slightly spikier and his eyes become [[grey eyes|silver-colored]]; in the latter form, alongside the previous additions, his hair becomes fully [[white hair|white]] and his hair becomes slightly more wild. Later, it is revealed that perfected Ultra Instinct can manifest a ki-based [[perfected ultra instinct giant form|Giant form]].

h4. See also

* [[Ultra Instinct Shaggy (meme)|]]
* [[Super Saiyan]]

title: chigusa_minori
body:

title: robe
body:
A loose-fitting outer garment, covering the body completely, that usually reaches the knees or feet.

A robe is distinguished from a [[cape]] or [[cloak]] by the fact that it usually has sleeves. Robes are often associated with [[wizard]]s and [[angel]]s, as well as with ceremonial events, such as [[graduation]]s.

h4. See also

* [[open robe]]

title: zundamon
body:
[b]Zundamon[/b] is a character who was originally created as [[VOICEROID]] [[Touhoku Zunko]]'s pet since 2017, but received an official [[personification]] and later a text-to-speech voicebank under the [[VOICEVOX]] software in August 2021. She later received a singing voicebank under [[NEUTRINO (software)|]] on July 31, 2022.

After the release of her text-to-speech voicebank, Zundamon became immensely popular within Japan and later aboard, to the point that she has completely overshadowed her original master Zunko.

Her gender was unknown until her human form's profile was released, describing her as a [[tomboy]]ish girl. Nevertheless, as [[VOICEROID]] characters are predominantly female, she is a popular target for [[genderswap]]s.

If Zundamon is only depicted in her [[Zundamon (UTAU)|UTAU]] (mascot) form, do not tag with [[VOICEVOX]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6748007
* !post #7806690: [[Zundamon (UTAU)|UTAU]]
* !post #6745135: Reference sheet
* !post #6745145: Clothing reference
* !post #6745189: Expression chart

h4. See also

* [[Ankomon]]
* [[Bishoujo Detective Zundamon]]
* [[List of vocal synth derivatives]]

title: truth
body:
Images with a mission to deliver an educational or insightful message.

The artist may attempt to:

* Challenge stereotypes.
* Debunk myths.
* Draw attention to and encourage discussion on commonly neglected or taken-for-granted issues.
* Encourage a neutral point of view on a normally polarizing topic.
* Offer helpful hints.
* Refute common misconceptions.
* Stating an obvious fact.
* Parody or satirize the above.

h6. Use on Danbooru

* Any image which carries such a message either in itself or an accompanying text [[commentary]] by the artist.

h6. Precautions

* Only use this tag for images where the artist is communicating in honesty or frankness.
* This tag is not for when an artist voiced a certain opinion, regardless if that said opinion is popular or not.
* When the image appears to forcefully push a particular point of view without regard for other opinions, the [[propaganda]] tag may be more appropriate.

h4. See also

* [[propaganda]]
* [[educational]]
* [[obvious statement]]

title: abuse
body:
When one person improperly treats another in order to gain personal benefit. It comes in many forms such as physical, sexual, financial, and emotional. For Danbooru, the emphasis is usually on physical abuse. To qualify, one person must have caused [[injury]] to another, who has become distressed or [[scared|frightened]] as a result.

h4. See Also
* [[animal abuse]]
* [[bullying]]
* [[child abuse]]
* [[domestic violence]]
* [[sexual harassment]]

title: eyebrows
body:
Most characters on danbooru have eyebrows. Use a better tag for unusual eyebrows instead, such as:

h4. Type of eyebrows

* !post #7427607: [[Eyebrows hidden by hair]], eyebrows that are hidden behind bangs but are still visible.
* !post #7531006: [[Hikimayu]], shaving off the eyebrows and painting new ones. Often in a distinctive comma shape or in a trapezoidal shape.
* !post #3333779: [[Raised eyebrows]], eyebrows are elevated from the usual resting position.
* !post #7355993: [[Raised eyebrow]], for when one eyebrow is raised but the other is not.
* !post #2366353: [[Cocked eyebrow]], for when one eyebrow is raised and the other is lowered.
* !post #5726330: [[Raised inner eyebrows]], eyebrows with only the inner ends raised. Often an expression of [[smug]]ness or [[fear]].
* !post #8034214: [[Forked eyebrows]], for eyebrows that are split at the outer ends.
* !post #5636658: [[Short eyebrows]], for unusually short eyebrows that only partially cover the brow ridges.
* !post #8002642: [[Thick eyebrows]], for unusually thick cases.
* !post #8041159: [[Huge eyebrows]], for when the eyebrow is thicker than thick.
* !post #7854327: [[Furrowed brow]], when the skin around the eyebrows becomes creased.
* !post #1871573: [[V-shaped  eyebrows]], slanted inwards, forming a V shape.
* !post #5906879: [[Curly eyebrows]], eyebrows that curl.
* !post #6305260: [[Unibrow]], eyebrows that are connected together.
* !post #5499154: [[Eyebrow piercing]], a piercing though the eyebrow.
* !post #7092324: [[Eyebrow cut]], a grooming style where one or more thin vertical stripes are shaved from one or both eyebrows.
* !post #7957120: [[Mismatched eyebrows]], for when the eyebrows are a different color than the character's hair.
* !post #1750845: [[Long eyebrows]], for unusually long eyebrows.

h6. Other
* [[no_eyebrows]]

title: speed_symboli_(umamusume)
body:
NPC Character from [[Umamusume]]. She is Japan's very first uma to go "gamble" at the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe, starting Japan's fascination with that particular race, and is considered to be a pioneer for going overseas to run in some of the world's most prestigious races.

While in-universe, [[Sirius Symboli (umamusume)|]] is her successor, in our universe, Speed Symboli is also [[Symboli Rudolf (umamusume)|]]'s RL Damsire.

Voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]].

h5. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Speed Symboli":[https://umamusume.jp/character/speedsymboli]

For her base and kai forms, she is portrayed with a [[white bikini]], white [[detached collar]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]], and [[thigh strap]]s containing her hull [[rigging]]. The art varies depending on form, with her using either [[headphones]] or a cargo [[net]] (a reference to the battle of Tassafaronga), and her hull either painted in plain Measure 13 (grey with blue deck) or Measure 12 Modified (blue camouflage).

title: chinese_pedestal_table
body:
A traditional Chinese elevated table or stand (花几/Huājǐ), also known as 花架 (Flower Rack) or 花台 (Flower Platform), Characterized by slender legs and ornate carvings, it serves both functional and symbolic purposes in classical interiors, often reflecting Confucian aesthetics of balance and harmony.

Frequently appears in scenes depicting traditional Chinese interior, imperial palace, or scholars study. Often paired with calligraphy scroll and incense burner to create a refined atmosphere.

Primarily used to elevate prized objects (e.g., blue and white porcelain, bonsai) for visual prominence in halls or studies.

title: az_(pokemon)
body:
A major character that appears in [[pokemon_xy|Pokémon XY]]. He was once the king of the Kalos region, but he appears in the story as a lone, incredibly tall wanderer.

3000 years prior to the game's events, he created a machine to revive his [[Floette (eternal)|]], which had died in action during a war that broke out at the time. Overcome by despair, he turned machine into the ultimate weapon that ended both sides of the war, bringing it to an end. The after-effects of this weapon granted him and his Pokémon immortality. Knowing that the weapon used the life energy of other Pokémon, the Floette parted ways with him.
H4. See also 
* "Bulbapedia":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/AZ

title: fuga_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Fuga[/b] (フウガ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

The chieftain of Hoshido’s Wind Tribe, he's the late King Sumeragi's best friend. He possesses a majesty unique to a veteran hero and his entire body exudes the presence of a stalwart warrior. He is [[Hayato_(fire_emblem)|]]'s adoptive father. He is the most loved by children.

He is voiced by Hiroshi Matsumoto in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Weapon Master

Shiro is the son of [[Ryoma (fire_emblem)|]] and the cousin of [[Kiragi (fire_emblem)|]]. Even though he is a little emotional with deep feelings of hatred, he is friendly and easy to get along with. He is the strongest arm wrestler out of everyone in the army.

He is voiced by Takumi Yasuaki in the Japanese version and by Kaiji Tang in the English localization.

Selkie is the daughter of [[Kaden_(fire_emblem)|]]. She has an innocent and cheerful personality, one that has never seen danger. She is the least afraid of things in the army.

body:
A playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]. 

She greatly resembles [[Tharja (Fire Emblem)|]] in many ways (including in personality and appearance, her name in both English and Japanese versions being anagrams of [[Tharja (Fire Emblem)|]]'s name; 'Saarya' -> 'Syara' & 'Tharja' -> 'Rhajat', in addition to sharing both her English and Japanese voice actresses.) 

She is voiced by Kana Akutsu  ([[Takada Yuuki]] since 2016) in the Japanese version and [[Stephanie Sheh]] in the English version.

[b]Starting Class[/b] - Diviner (Mage)

h4. Appearance

* !post #2938213

title: mitama_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Mitama[/b] is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Mitama is the daughter of [[azama_(fire_emblem)|Azama]]. She is normally very polite but is known to have a sharp tongue like her father. Still, she thinks that her father is a nag. She loves sleeping as much as she can and spends the most amount of time dreaming, more so than anyone else in the army.

She speaks almost entirely in haiku and has [[star-shaped pupils]].

She is voiced by Azusa Satou in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Priestess

She is the daughter of [[Subaki (fire_emblem)|Subaki]]. Inspired by her father's perfection, Caeldori devoted herself to train and eventually become perfect like him.

title: omikuji
body:
Random fortunes written on strips of paper at [[Shinto]] [[shrine]]s in Japan. Tying these strips of paper to trees or wires is a common custom, especially when receiving a negative fortune.

The short messages that may be found on them follow below, ordered tentatively from worst to best:

* 大凶 (dai-kyou), Great Curse
* 末凶 (sue-kyou), Future Curse
* 半凶 (han-kyou), Half-Curse
* 小凶 (shou-kyou), Small Curse
* 凶 (kyou), Curse
* 末小吉 (sue-shou-kichi), Future small Blessing
* 末吉 (sue-kichi), Future Blessing
* 半吉 (han-kichi), Half-Blessing
* 吉 (kichi), Blessing
* 小吉 (shou-kichi), Small Blessing
* 中吉 (chuu-kichi), Middle Blessing
* 大吉 (dai-kichi), Great Blessing

The temples and shrines across Japan do not have a unified system for their omikuji. Some places do not offer the full range of fortunes, and a few offer an additional fortune rank:
* 平 (hira), Neutral

How the unmodified "Blessing" ranks compare to Small and Middle blessings also varies.

h4. See also

* [[tied omikuji]]
* [[chinese fortune sticks]]

title: chinese_fortune_sticks
body:
A fortune telling practice that originated in China in which a person poses questions and interprets answers from flat [[stick]]s inscribed with text or numerals and contained in a long cylindrical bamboo cup or [[tube]]. The practice is often performed in a [[Taoism|Taoist]] or [[Buddhism|Buddhist]] temple in front of an altar. 

h4. See also
* [[Omikuji]]

title: sanpaku
body:
Eyes that noticeably show the whites around most of the iris during a state of rest. Can also indicate anger, exhaustion, or a dangerous demeanor. Sometimes referred to as "Dead fish eyes" among Western speakers.

The Japanese expression literally translates to "three white" as in the whites of the eyes being visible to three of four sides of the iris when the person with sanpaku eyes is looking straight ahead or when their eyes are at rest. 
The most extreme form is called [i]shihakugan[/i], meaning "four-white eyes".

h4. Examples

* !post #4905216
* !post #7732758
* !post #2470147

h4. See also

* [[jitome]] - eyes topped with a flat line
* sanpaku - eyes that show white primarily above or below the iris
* [[tareme]] - eyes with a rounded, drooping shape
* [[tsurime]] - eyes with an upward outer "point"
* [[upturned eyes]] - eyes also with whites visible below the iris, but with a soft, gentle expression looking upwards rather than a harsh or unhinged one.
* [[wide-eyed]] - eyes that show white around normal iris
* [[Tag Group:Eyes tags]]

h4. External links

* Pixivision: "Drawings of Girls with Sanpaku Eyes - Strength is in the Eyes":[https://www.pixivision.net/en/a/5822]

title: love_live!_school_idol_project
body:
The first entry in the [[Love Live!]] franchise, a Japanese multimedia project co-developed by "ASCII Media Works":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ASCII_Media_Works]' "Dengeki G's Magazine":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dengeki_G%27s_Magazine], music label "Lantis":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lantis_%28company%29], and animation studio [[Sunrise (company)|]]. 

The series follows several girls from Otonokizaka High School who get together to form the idol group μ's (pronounced Muse), to attract new students to their school and prevent it from closing.

title: mifune_shioriko
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Elected student council president of Nijigasaki, succeeding [[Yuki Setsuna]]. 

Her personality varies greatly between [[love live! school idol festival all stars|ALL STARS]] and the anime. In ALL STARS, she is very heavy-handed at first, practically ousting Setsuna out of the position of student council president. In the anime, she is much more neutral, helping out with club activities at first. In both cases, her motivation stems from her older sister, [[Mifune Kaoruko]], who was once a school idol.

She has [[red eyes|red]] or [[orange eyes|orange eyes]], and a [[short hair|short]] to [[medium hair|medium]] [[green hair|green]]-[[black hair|black]] [[bob cut]] with [[swept bangs]] and a small [[hair ribbon]] on the side. She typically has a clearly defined [[fang]]. As the student council president, sometimes she wears a red [[armband]].

She is a member of [[R3BIRTH (love live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Koizumi Moeka]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #7411619

* [[Ketsui no Hikari]]

title: konoe_kanata
body:
A character from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Kanata is very sleepy and is prone to taking naps during the day, often carrying a [[pillow]] with her. She is very easygoing and prone to napping in the laps of others.

She has [[large breasts]] and [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]], [[brown hair|brown]] or [[orange hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears a [[orange cardigan]] with [[sleeves past wrists]] under her winter uniform and a [[yellow jacket|yellow]] [[jacket]] on top of her summer uniform.

She is a member of [[QU4RTZ (love live!)|]].

title: miyashita_ai
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]] and a second year student at Nijigasaki High School. Despite her gyaru style and flashy, loud appearance, Ai is a kindhearted, reliable girl who loves making puns.

She is a [[gyaru]] with [[yellow eyes|yellow]] or [[orange eyes|orange]] eyes and [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[blonde hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and [[bangs]]. At school she ties her hair into a [[half updo]] or a [[ponytail]] with a [[hair flower]]. In her free time she lets her her hair down except for a [[side braid]] on the front.

She wears a [[brown cardigan]] with her winter uniform instead of the regular black jacket, during summer she keeps the cardigan but ties it [[cardigan around waist|around her waist]] instead and wears a [[wrist scrunchie]] and [[bracelet]]s.

She is a member of [[DiverDiva]].

Voiced by [[Murakami Natsumi (voice actor)|]].

body:

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[blue hair|blue]]-[[black hair]], arranged with [[blunt bangs]]. She usually wears [[black pantyhose]] with her [[nijigasaki school uniform|school uniform]].

She is a member of [[DiverDiva]].

title: uehara_ayumu
body:
A character from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. The [i]de facto[/i] onstage leader of the Nijigasaki High School Idol Club, Ayumu is a hardworking girl that puts her all into what she does. She can be very clumsy at times. Her childhood friend, depending on medium, is either [[Takasaki Yu]] (anime) or [[Anata-chan (love live!)|]] (ALL STARS).

She has [[yellow eyes|yellow]]-[[green eyes]] and [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[pink hair|pink]]-[[orange hair]], arranged in a [[half updo]] with [[swept bangs|swept]], [[blunt bangs]] (often held by [[hairclip]]s) and a [[single side bun]] with a [[bun with braided base|braid wrapped around it]].

title: sakura_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Sakura[/b] (サクラ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

The youngest princess of the Hoshidan royal family, she has a very shy personality, using honorifics even when talking to family members, but is strong-willed. She is the best healer in the army and her birthday is April 9th.

She is voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]] in the Japanese version and by Brianna Knickerbocker in the English version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Shrine Maiden (Cleric)

title: saizo_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Saizo[/b] (サイゾウ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A ninja of Hoshido, he is one of [[ryoma (fire emblem)|Ryoma]]'s personal retainers. He has taken a blood oath to serve Lord Ryouma absolutely. [[kaze (fire emblem)|Kaze]] is his twin brother.

He is voiced by Shigasa Tarusuke in the Japanese version and by Ben Diskin in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Ninja -> Master Ninja/Jounin

h4. Appearance

* !post #2618713
* !post #6853248: [[saizo (ninja) (fire emblem)|Ninja]]

title: ryoma_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]. 

The eldest brother of the Hoshidan royal family. [[corrin (fire emblem)|Corrin]] (the Avatar)'s real elder brother. A very reliable person who is the epitome of the way of the warrior, a prime practitioner of Bushido. He is not only regarded as a talented warrior and leader, but also provides much comfort and support to the Avatar. He wields the legendary lightning katana [[raijinto (fire emblem)|Raijintou]].

Ryouma has [[very long hair|very]] [[long hair|long]] [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]], and wears [[red armor|red]] [[armor]] with [[white pants|white]] [[pants]] and a [[white coat|white]] [[long coat]] on top of his signature protective [[mask]].

He is voiced by [[Nakamura Yuuichi]] in the Japanese version and by [[Matthew Mercer]] in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Swordmaster

h4. Appearance

title: rinkah_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Rinkah[/b] (リンカ, [i]Rinka[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She is from the Tribe of Flames, which is an independent group from the Kingdom. Following her father (the chief)'s orders, she moved to assist the Kingdom of Hoshido. In accordance with her tribe’s custom of honoring solitude, she does not interact with her comrades more than is necessary.

She is voiced by [[Ishikawa Yui]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Oni Savage

body:

She is a Spellcaster employed by the castle that expensive magic can be bought from. Though she has mysterious vibes with her calm, old fashioned manner of speaking, she actually has a bright and playful personality.

[[Takumi (fire emblem)|]]'s subordinate. She is a fashionista with a fittingly feminine personality, and has a crush on her liege. Because of her past, her hatred for Nohr is greater than others.

title: pan-chan_(blue_archive)
body:
Part monster, part culinary disaster created by [[juri_(blue_archive)|Juri]] from [[Blue Archive]]. It resembles a cross between a purple octopus and a stack of pancakes with green syrup poured over it.

In Pandemic Hazard, it was known to be Juri's creation, this culinary abomination is also edible despite the "odd" looking pancake. A huge version also appears.

body:
[b]Kagero[/b] (カゲロウ, [i]Kagerou[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

body:
[b]Kaden[/b] (ニシキ, [i]Nishiki[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A Kitsune youth who lives in a remote region of Hoshido. Following his father's footsteps, he acts as his clan's leader and keeps his people in order. Very concerned with his appearance, Nishiki is often found grooming himself, so that his fur remains in top condition. He apparently has the best attitude.

title: hinata_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Hinata[/b] (ヒナタ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A samurai who serves [[Takumi (fire emblem)|]]. He was born into a samurai clan that has served the Hoshido Royal Family for generations. He's easily fooled and quick to anger, but is extremely quick to befriend and is adept at pulling people together.

He is voiced by Ichiki Mitsuhiro in the Japanese version and by Cam Clarke in the English localization.

body:
[b]Hayato[/b] (ツクヨミ, [i]Tsukuyomi[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]. 

A spellcaster of the Tribe of Winds. A young boy with extraordinary ability. This influences his self confidence, to the point where it is rather high-handed. On the other hand, his weakness is being childish in some ways, such as being afraid of the dark.

title: hana_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Hana[/b] (カザハナ, [i]Kazahana[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She serves [[Sakura (fire emblem)|]]. She is one of the best swordsmen in the country, and her father served King Sumeragi. While not of noble birth, Sakura is her liege and best friend since childhood. To protect Sakura, she muddies herself every day while training rigorously.

She is voiced by Sugaya Yayoi in the Japanese version.

body:
[b]Ignatius[/b] (イグニス, [i]Ignis[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Ignatius is the son of [[Benny_(fire_emblem)|]]. Though he looks unsociable at a glance, he is a timid, easily frightened person, much like his father. He is fond of cute things, which he is very shy about.

title: forrest_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Forrest[/b] (フォレオ, [i]Foleo[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Forrest is the son of [[leo (fire emblem fates)|Leo]] and the cousin of [[siegbert_(fire_emblem)|Siegbert]]. A notably kind, sympathetic young man, he also has a great fashion sense and excels at making clothes. He also suffers from hemophobia.

He is voiced by Yuuta Takahashi in the Japanese version and by Max Mittelman in the English localization. Forrest is the only character who shares his English voice actor with his own father.

title: hoshi_wo_miru_hito
body:
[b]Hoshi wo Miru Hito[/b] (lit. "Stargazer") is an RPG game developed by Another and published by HOT-B in 1987 for [[Famicom]]. Due to its glaring flaws, it's known as the "densetsu no kusoge" (伝説のクソゲー legendary shitty game). A patch was released to balance the game and improve the graphics in its subsequent release, and there even exist two fan remakes.

In May 2020, it was revealed that the game would receive a digital re-release on the Nintendo Switch in the summer later that year, and was released worldwide on July 30th. Despite the worldwide release, the game was not translated, meaning it's only in Japanese.

h4. See also
* [[Stargazer (series)|Stargazer]] (a fan remake released on 2009)
* [[Romancing Stella Visor]] (a fan remake released in 2015)

title: yuki_miku_(2023)
body:
The 2023 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest for this year was 空模様 (weather/condition of the sky) showing the imagery of Hokkaido winter.

The winning entry was drawn by [[isakysaku]] and features a daybreak motif with a pastel palette. The main visual was illustrated by [[ancotaku]].

Her [[light blue hair]] ends with a [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair|gradient]]. She wears a [[bonnet]] with a pink [[bowtie]]. Her [[twintails]] are adorned with [[sun_hair_ornament|sun]] and [[crescent_hair_ornament|crescent moon]] hair ornaments. She carries a giant [[paintbrush]] which she uses to paint the sky of the new day.

She is given the fan nickname 冬麗ちゃん (Fuyu Urara-chan) in Japanese, meaning "clear/beautiful winter". Her English fan nickname is "Serenity":[https://twitter.com/isaky_tm/status/1565583293935980544].

Her theme song is [[SnowMix_(vocaloid)|]] by Marasy, with PV illustrated by [[Omutatsu]].

h4. Official art

* !post #5790757: Main visual

title: yuki_miku_(2021)
body:
"Glowing Snow ver"

The 2021 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest was "illumination". The winning design by [[annatumikan]] features a choir outfit with a clock motif based on the [[Sapporo Clock Tower]].

Her fan nickname is [i]Tokei-chan[/i] (Clock-chan).

She has a [[clock print]] [[beret]], [[white dress]] and [[capelet]], [[blue tabard]] with [[gold trim]] and [[Christmas lights]] adorning her hair and dress.

Her theme song is [b][[fondant_step_(vocaloid)|Fondant Step]][/b] by Heavenz.

title: yuki_miku_(2019)
body:
The 2019 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest for this year was "Princess" showing the imagery of Hokkaido winter.

Her fan nickname is also simply "Princess" (プリンセス).

The winning entry was done by [[linfi-muu|LF]] and features a Western-style outfit with a blue and white [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[frilled dress]], [[puffy detached sleeves]], [[white cape]], crystal earrings and studs on her hair, and a [[tiara]]. She wields a crystal [[scepter]].

Her theme song is [b]Ai[/b] by DECO*27.

title: electronic_arts
body:
An American video Game company. Known for producing many multiplayer focused games, and employing questionable monetization systems in many of their titles. Throughout the years, they have acquired numerous studios and come to own many franchises, including holding the exclusive rights to produce the Madden [[national football league|NFL]] [[american football]] games and [[FIFA]] [[soccer|football]] games (until 2023 when they lost the FIFA license). title: blanket
body:
A large piece of woolen or similar material used as a [[bed]] covering or other covering for warmth. Most [[kotatsu]] are covered by a blanket to trap heat underneath.

An alternative use for blankets is to cover the ground to make a seating area for [[picnic|picnics]].

title: thomas_the_tank_engine_(character)
body:
The titular character of [[Thomas the Tank Engine]] series. Thomas is an anthropomorphized LB&SCR E2 class steam [[locomotive]] with cheeky yet somewhat naive personality.

He will later on becoming the most popular character of the series, as well as gaining a recurring [[meme]] status in a large variety of formats. Ranging from appearing as an unstoppable machine in YTP, a "swaggy douchebag" in [[MLG]] parodies, as well as an emotionless demonic being or super-mecha in various western and eastern parody fanarts.

h4. See also
* [[Peppa Pig]] (another kid-orientated character of similar memetic fame.)

title: jewelpet_(series)
body:
Jewelpet is a Japanese media franchise and toy line created in 2008 as a joint venture between [[Sanrio]] and [[Sega Sammy|Sega Sammy Holdings]], produced by the third character designer of [[Hello Kitty]], Yuko Yamaguchi, and illustrated by the character designer of [[Cinnamoroll]], Miyuki Okumura. The franchise was originally launched on January 15, 2008, focusing on animals named after jewels, birthstones and minerals, who can use magic using their eyes.

Due to the success of the franchise, Sanrio and Sega Sammy expanded the Jewelpet franchise overseas. The franchise is currently being licensed by Giochi Preziosi for its European release.

The series official slogan is [i]"Eyes of Jewel that Shine, glittering with Luck and Good Fortune".[/i]

h4. Anime Seasons

* [[Jewelpet]] (2008)
* [[Jewelpet_Twinkle|Jewelpet Twinkle☆]] (2010)

* [[Jewelpet Happiness]] (2013)
* [[Lady Jewelpet]] (2014)
* [[Jewelpet Magical Change]] (2015)

h4. External links

title: hinamatsuri
body:
A Japanese festival held on March 3. Platforms covered with a red carpet ([[hinadan]]) are used to display a set of ornamental dolls ([[hina ningyou]]) representing the Emperor, Empress, attendants, and musicians in traditional court dress of the Heian period. [[Hina arare]] are eaten during this festival.

h4. See also

title: god_cloth
body: The God Cloths, are a unique class of Cloths worn by [[Athena (Saint Seiya)|Athena]]'s Saints that have existed since the Age of Myth. Transformed by spilling Athena's blood on the original Cloths, these new Cloths provide their Saints a level of protection and power that surpasses that of Gold Saints and even some minor Gods, such as [[Thanatos (Saint Seiya)|Thanatos]] and [[Hypnos (Saint Seiya)|Hypnos]]  and are second only to the original armors of the 12 Olympians, the Kamui. In the manga the armor is completely golden, while in the anime each of the wearers (except the [[Gold Saint|12 Gold Saints]] and [[Phoenix Ikki|Ikki]]) has a unique color.

title: dragon_ball_heroes
body:
Developed by Bandai off the heels of [[Dragon Ball Z]] [[dragon ball kai|Kai]], [b]Dragon Ball Heroes[/b] is an arcade trading card game ([[carddass]]) using the [[Dragon Ball]] property, later renamed to [b]Super Dragon Ball Heroes[/b]. It is infamous in the West for its perceived fan service, giving characters access to forms they previously hadn't obtained/used, and just generally being absurd in its plotlines.

Starting with [i]Dragon Ball Heroes: God Mission[/i], more plot elements were introduced into the game (largely drawn from [[Dragon Ball Online]], similarly to [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse]] that same year), and has since developed it through several mediums, including the arcade game itself, its manga adaptations ([[Toyotarou]]'s Victory Mission, and the more faithful Nagayama Yoshitaka serializations), its handheld console adaptations on Nintendo platforms, and an anime adaptation starting from its-then-latest storyline, [i]Universe Mission[/i]. All of these adaptations have story elements that add or diverge from the original arcade game, and could thus be considered their own separate timelines to some extent, similarly to its relation to the Xenoverse series.

Dragon Ball Heroes would largely be confined to Japanese shores, but from July to October of 2018, the arcade game was shown in 7 North American towns as part of an American tour, marking its first appearance overseas. The 2019 game [i]Super Dragon Ball Heroes: World Mission[/i], the fourth console adaptation of the arcade game for Nintendo Switch, would be the first to not only properly release in English, but also internationally.

Dragon Ball Heroes would be retired by November 2024, to be replaced by a brand new arcade game in the form of "Dragon Ball Super Divers":[https://twitter.com/Venixys/status/1889963679992647949], which replaced its machines and features a legacy Heroes mode which players can access to make use of their cards still.
other_names: ドラゴンボールヒーローズ

title: shidare_hotaru
body:
Main female character from [[Dagashi Kashi]]. She is an avid dagashi ([[sweets]]) enthusiast. 
She is trying to convince [[shikada_kokonotsu|Kokonotsu]] to inherit his father's shop.

Being from the city, she is a lot more fashionable than the other characters in the series. She wears [[ankle strap]] [[pumps]], a [[frills|frilled]] [[blouse]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[ribbon]] or [[red bow|red]] [[bow]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist_skirt|high-waist]] [[suspender skirt]], and [[black pantyhose|black]] [[thighband pantyhose|thighband]] [[pantyhose]]. (See also [[Virgin Killer Outfit]]; Hotaru serves as one of the codifiers of this style)

In terms of looks, she has [[purple hair|purple]] [[bob cut]] that reaches just above her shoulders, ornated with a [[black hairband]] with a [[black rose]], [[ringed_eyes|ringed]] [[purple eyes|purple]] or [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

body:
[[Princess Daisy]] wearing her attire from [i][[Mario Tennis Open]][/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A sleeveless yellow dress with a tiered orange hem that creates a scalloped, layered look around the skirt portion. The skirt portion’s tiers transition from yellow near the top to orange at the bottom.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White ankle socks.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Orange shoes with a bright yellow toe cap.
* [b]Accessories[/b]:
** She has large, round teal ornaments—matching her classic jewelry set—on her earrings and on the brooch at the center of her dress’s neckline.
** There’s a small white ruffle collar just beneath her chin.

[spoilers]Personality-wise, this Idunn is based on the one implied to exist in [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]]'s true ending, with Idunn being slowly [[light persona|cured from her physical and mental corruption]].[/spoilers]

title: law-chan
body:
A [[genderswap]]ed version of [[Trafalgar Law]] from [[One Piece]].

In [[One Piece]] Chapter 1063, [spoiler]the Heart Pirates ([[trafalgar_law|Law]]'s crew) were ambushed by the Blackbeard Pirates. In the middle of the battle Law and his members became temporarily afflicted with [[genderswap_(mtf)|Feminization Disease]][/spoiler] which turned him and several of his crewmates into women.

title: xiezhi_guan
body:
The Xiezhi is a type of Chinese hat (guan), worn by law enforcement officials in the past. It is named after the [i]Xiezhi[/i], a mythological animal that deducts right from wrong.

It is rectangular in shape, with upper edges that taper outwards. Often features dangling accessories such as [[hat tassel|tassels]].

* !post #3160512

It is the iconic hat of [[Yanfei_(genshin_impact)|]] from [[Genshin Impact]].

h4. See Also
* [[Chinese clothes]]
* [[Dianzi]]
* [[Xiao guan (headdress)|]]

title: swinging_on_swing
body:
When a character is using a [[swing]] to swing themselves around.

Should only be used when it is clear the character is swinging on the swing rather than only being [[on swing|on the swing]], which can be hard to determine with still images. Look for [[motion lines]], someone else [[pushing]] the character on the swing, or a character's pose indicating they are mid-swing.

h4.Correct examples
* !post #4712939: [[Sitting]] while swinging on a swing
* !post #7348319: [[Uesugi Fuutarou]] and [[Nakano Yotsuba]] [[standing on swing|standing on a swing]] while still swinging on it still

h4.Incorrect examples
* !post #6866877: Both [[Toga Himiko]] and [[Uraraka Ochaco]] sitting on a swing but not swinging on one
* !post #6034898: [[alice (alice in wonderland)|Alice]] only standing on a swing

body:

Not to be confused with [[paint splatter on face]] which is for paint splatters on a character's face.

title: xander_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Xander[/b] (マークス, [i]Mākusu[/i]) is a playable character in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates]][/i].

The crown prince of the kingdom of Nohr. Xander has an aloof but dignified and courageous character, putting his country's needs above all else even at his own expense. Along with the other royal siblings, he was subject to the family's "concubine wars" at a young age. He is said to have the best handwriting out of those in the army, and his birthday is on October 27th.

He is voiced by [[Konishi Katsuyuki]] in Japanese and David Stanbra in English.

[b]Starting Class:[/b] Paladin

title: about:mod_queue
body:
h4. What is Danbooru's Moderation Queue?

Danbooru's Moderation Queue (usually referred to as "modqueue") is a system in place to filter out images which do not meet [[help:upload|Danbooru's Quality Standards]].

[[help:users|Approvers]] are responsible for approving posts in the queue ([[help:users]]). You can view a list of them "here":/users?commit=Search&search%5Blevel%5D=>=37.

h4. How does the modqueue work?

h6. In Short:
1. A new post is uploaded by a user who is below [[help:users|contributor level]].
2. The post is placed in the modqueue.
3. Approvers review the post.
4. If there are no approvals within 3 days, the post is deleted.
5. If any approver approves the post, the approved post is now active and remains on Danbooru indefinitely.
6. If the post is flagged by another user, go to Step 2.

Posts which are in the Queue are distinguished by their blue border when browsing thumbnails. 

The full Queue may be listed by using the search metatag [b]{{status:pending}}[/b]. Approvers may use [b]{{status:unmoderated}}[/b] outside of the modqueue interface to see the pending posts they haven't made a decision on.

h6. Exceptions and Exemptions:

"All contributors and above":/help/users can post directly to active status, bypassing the modqueue. This privilege is given to frequent uploaders with a track record of uploading consistently high-quality art, to allow them to contribute to the collection without the constraints of the modqueue.

h4. Help Us Keep Our Gallery Clean!

If you find a particularly low quality post that doesn't belong on Danbooru, you may [[howto:flag|flag]] the post to have it return to the modqueue for a second check.

Simply open the post in full view, and click on [b]Flag[/b] on the left pane, third choice from the top under [b]Options[/b]. You will be prompted to enter your reason for returning the post to the Queue. Click on OK, and the image's approval will be reconsidered.

h4. What should I do about my deleted Posts?

Most of the time, it is safe to assume that every post in the Queue has been reviewed at least once.

If an upload isn't approved after three days, it is mostly because it doesn't meet our quality standards. It is comparatively rare for a high-quality post to end up getting deleted because the Queue missed it.

With the understanding that the manual and subjective process of the modqueue has its inherent flaws, post deletions may be appealed. For information on lodging a deletion appeal, please consult [[howto:appeal|the article on appeals]].

h4. Go Back

* "Return to the Terms of Service and Moderation section of the Table of Contents":/wiki_pages/help:toc#dtext-terms_of_service_and_moderation
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: aaron_paul
body: Aaron Paul (born Aaron Paul Sturtevant; August 27, 1979) is an American actor and producer. He is best known for portraying Jesse Pinkman in the AMC series [[Breaking Bad]] (2008–2013), for which he won several awards, including three Primetime Emmy Awards for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series, a joint-record since its separation into comedy and drama, as well as a Golden Globe Award nomination. Paul also won the Saturn Award for Best Supporting Actor on Television a record three times. He reprised the role in the Netflix sequel film El Camino (2019), and during the final season of spin-off series [[Better Call Saul]] (2022).

title: eiyuuou_bu_wo_kiwameru_tame_tenseisu:_soshite_sekai_saikyou_no_minarai_kishi
body:
Eiyuu-Ou bu wo Kiwameru Tame Tensei Su ~Soshite Sekai Saikyou no Minarai Kishi♀~ (English Title: "Reborn to Master the Blade: From Hero-King to Extraordinary Squire") is a 2019-to-present Japanese fantasy light novel series written by Hayaken and illustrated by [[Nagu]].  The series began publication as a webnovel in early 2019, with the light novel and manga adaptation starting late 2019 .  A mini two-episode net anime aired in late 2020, and a tv anime adaptation was announced on November 2021.

h4. Major Characters

* [[Inglis Eucus]]
* [[Rafinha Bilford]]

title: peri_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Peri[/b] (ピエリ, [i]Pieri[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A cavalier who serves [[Xander (fire emblem)|]]. A prestigious aristocrat who was born a proper lady. Although she has an innocent and childish personality, she loves to fight. If she senses danger on the battlefield so potent she begins to weep, she changes into an unrecognizable berserker who moves to enemies to annihilate them.

She is voiced by [[Takahashi Minami (voice Actor)|]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Cavalier

h4. Appearance

* !post #2619763

A shaman who lives in the Kingdom of Nohr. Contrary to her youthful appearance, she is very mature and of older age. Though she is a talented shaman, she lives a quiet life as a fortune teller.

She is voiced by Kimura Juri in the Japanese version.

title: the_magician_(tarot)
body:
The first of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

Traditionally a practitioner of ordinary stage magic, the Magician became a [[wizard]] in occult decks designed for divination. The Magician usually has one hand pointing skyward and the other hand pointed to the ground. Many depictions of the Magician include items symbolizing the four suits of the Minor Arcana: a [[wand]], a [[cup]], a [[sword]] or [[knife]], and a [[pentacle]] or [[coin]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24747541: [[Rider-Waite tarot|Rider-Waite]]

title: leo_(fire_emblem_fates)
body:
[b]Leo[/b] (レオン Reon) is a playable character in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates]][/i].

He is the younger prince of Nohr and a general of the kingdom's army. Unlike his older brother Xander, he uses magic. A master tactician, Leo is known for his keen intellect and sharp tongue. Along with the other royal siblings, he was subject to the family's "concubine wars" at a young age. He likes tomatoes the most out of anyone in the army, and his birthday is on June 30th.

He is voiced by [[Miyano Mamoru]] in Japanese and "Max Mittelman":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_Mittelman in English.

[b]Starting Class:[/b] Dark Knight

h4. Appearance

title: keaton_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Keaton[/b] (フランネル, [i]Flannel[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Keaton is a Wolfskin, capable of turning into werewolf-like creatures. Living on Mount Garou, a Nohrian mountain range, he is the leader of his pack. While well-dressed and fulfilling a leader function, he is extremely messy and not in the least bit concerned with his appearance. He is most attracted to objects out of everyone in the army.

He is voiced by Jun Osuka in the Japanese version and by Gideon Emery in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Wolfskin

h4. Appearance

* !post #2286985

title: elise_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Elise[/b] (エリーゼ Erize) is a playable character in [i][[Fire Emblem Fates]][/i].

The youngest child of the Nohrian royal family. Elise displays a naive and childish personality, treating her immediate family with generous love and consideration. However, she is deceptively sharp, being able to sometimes see truths that others may miss. Along with the other royal siblings, she was subject to the family's "concubine wars" at a young age. She is said to be the best at remembering birthdays, and her birthday is on March 19th.

She is voiced by [[Suwa Ayaka]] in Japanese and "Natalie Lander":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natalie_Lander in English.

[b]Starting Class:[/b] Troubadour

title: charlotte_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She is a mercenary of the border of the Kingdom of Nohr. She appears to be a truly kind girl to anyone who talks to her, but this is just a ruse to get any man under her control. Her true nature is that of a strong yet crude hand-to-hand fighter. She dreams of marrying into high wealth and social status.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]] and prominent [[lips]]. She wears a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow|hair]] [[bow]] and a [[bikini armor|skimpy]] [[armor|armored]] outfit.

She is voiced by Shimizu Ai in the Japanese version and by Brianna Knickerbocker in the English localization. Her starting class is Fighter, making her the first female Fighter in the series.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4647854
* !post #2740549: [[charlotte (money maiden) (fire emblem)|Money Maiden]]

title: agent_3_(splatoon)
body:
Protagonist of [i][[splatoon_1|Splatoon]][/i]'s Hero Mode.

They are recruited into the [[squidbeak splatoon|New Squidbeak Splatoon]] by [[Cap'n Cuttlefish]] to help retrieve the [[zapfish]] from the underground civilization of Octo Valley.

Due to Agent 3 being the player character, they can be depicted as either gender, though they are often drawn as a girl with [[green_hair|green]] [[tentacle hair]] thanks to promotional materials surrounding Hero Mode. Regardless, Agent 3 always wears a "hero suit" consisting of a bright yellow safety vest and pointed [[headgear]].

By the time of [i][[Splatoon 3]][/i], they have succeeded Cuttlefish as the captain of the New Squidbeak Splatoon. In this game, they are now simply known as "Captain", while [[agent 3 (splatoon 3)|a new agent]] inherits their former "Agent 3" callsign. 

* For their Splatoon 3 appearance: See [i][[Captain 3 (Splatoon)]][/i]

title: delta_force_(video_game)
body: Delta Force is a FPS video game series originally developed by NovaLogic and now currently owned by [[tencent_qq|TiMi Studio Group]]. Taking the role as a member of Delta Force, a [[real life]] [[Military Operator|Special Forces]] group of the [[United States Army]], the player is tasked all over the world to battle terrorists, international criminals, rebels and enemy military forces.

title: beruka_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Beruka[/b] (ベルカ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She serves under [[Camilla (fire emblem)|]] as a go getting hitwoman. She has an expressionless face and is taciturn, leading her to be a person who projects an inhospitable aura. She joined as Camilla's favorite "strong woman" and thus is her right hand.

She is voiced by Tazawa Masumi in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Wyvern Rider

h4. Appearance 

* !post #2618711

title: benny_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Benny[/b] (ブノワ, [i]Benoit[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A border guard serving the Kingdom of Nohr. The same as Charlotte. He is a great man with a scary face that both his allies and enemies fear. However, he is nice inside, somewhat cowardly, and always thinking of his comrades. He carries a homemade charm with him into battle.

Benny is extremely tall and very [[muscular male| muscular]], has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], as well as a [[scar on forehead|scar on his forehead]]. He wears [[black armor|black]] [[armor]] into battle.

He is voiced by Kiyama Shigeo in the Japanese version and by Imari Williams in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Knight

h4. Appearance

* !post #4806578

title: arthur_(fire_emblem_fates)
body:
[b]Arthur[/b] (ハロルド, [i]Harold[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

[[Elise (fire emblem)|]]'s subordinate. He crushes evil and protects justice, He's a Hero of Justice, specifically! He has always followed the path of the righteous, all his life, like the waves flow he has obeyed this rule. He has extremely bad luck, which is even reflected in gameplay by his abysmal Luck stat and growth. [spoiler]However, his luck is said to improve in his old age.[/spoiler]

He is voiced by Kitazawa Riki in the Japanese version and by Cam Clarke in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Fighter 

h4. Appearance

* !post #2499998

title: sophie_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Sophie[/b] (ゾフィー, Zofi) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Sophie is the daughter of [[silas_(fire_emblem)|Silas]]. Sophie is extremely prone to making mistakes, but is always optimistic and cheerful. She talks to herself more than anyone.

She is voiced by Sakura Nakamura in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Cavalier

h4. Appearance

* !post #2246430

title: midori_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She is the daughter of [[kaze (fire emblem)|Kaze]], niece of [[saizo_(fire_emblem)|Saizo]], and cousin of [[asugi_(fire_emblem)|Asugi]]. Has the most acute sense of taste.

She is voiced by [[Kouno Marika]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Herb Merchant

h4. Appearance

* !post #3852231

title: the_world_(tarot)
body:
The twenty-first of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The World is traditionally represented by a woman [[floating|hovering]] above the Earth, with a [[wand]] in each hand, surrounded by a [[wreath]]. In many decks, The World has four creatures watching from its corners: an [[eagle]], a [[lion]], an [[bull|ox]], and a human.

h4.See also

title: dwyer_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Dwyer[/b] (ディーア, [i]Deere[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Deere is the son of [[jakob_(fire_emblem)|Jakob]]. Deere is normally seen competing against his father in some form or manner. Although lazy and apathetic, his motto is "work before rest". He is a naturally skilled butler and at combat. He has the most hidden talents.

He is voiced by Yuuichi Iguchi in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Rod Knight

h4. Appearance

* !post #2208249

body:

title: shura_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Shura[/b] (アシュラ, [i]Asura[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A thief from Nohr. Born in the Principality of Kouga. It is hard to say if he is a "good person", but he is kind and good at taking care of people. He is the best long-distance swimmer out of everyone in the army.

He is voiced by Madoka Shiga in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Adventurer

h4. Appearance

* !post #2286979

title: izana_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Izana[/b] (イザナ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Ruler of the Principality of Izumo. He has an unexpectedly cheerful and joking personality in contrast to his beautiful and divine appearance.

He is voiced by Toochika Kouichi in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Onmyoji

h4. Appearance

* !post #8129407

title: silas_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Silas[/b] (サイラス, [i]Sairasu[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A new knight in the Kingdom of Nohr, and [[corrin (fire emblem)|Corrin]] (the Avatar)'s childhood friend. He has a kind heart and puts his friends before himself at all times. However, he is a very wary person as well, one who would sacrifice himself for an ally who had let their guard down.

He is voiced by Okumura Shou in the Japanese version and by Antony Del Rio in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Cavalier

h4. Appearance

* !post #3384669

title: mozu_(fire_emblem)
body:

h4. Appearance

* !post #2957536

title: kaze_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Kaze[/b] (スズカぜ, [b]Sukukaze[/b] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Hails from a family that has served the Hoshidan royal family for generations. He does not serve a particular master, and so just serves the castle itself. He is polite and has quite a composed personality.

He is voiced by [[Ono Daisuke]] in the Japanese version and by David Stanbra in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Ninja

h4. Appearance

* !post #3100250

title: jakob_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Jakob[/b] (ジョーカー [i]Joker[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Serves as a steward to [[corrin (fire emblem)|Corrin]] (the Avatar) within the Kingdom of Nohr. He has keen intellect, and does everything from housework to odd jobs with great skill. However, he is rather unsociable to anybody who is not the Avatar.

He is voiced by [[Suwabe Jun'ichi]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Butler

h4. Appearance

* !post #2619743
* !post #2907140: [[jakob (devoted monster) (fire emblem)|Devoted Monster]]

title: felicia_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Felicia[/b] (フェリシア, [i]Ferishia[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

The maid who serves [[corrin (fire emblem)|Corrin]] (the Avatar) by doing all the tasks they need in the Kingdom of Nohr. While she is brave and tries her best, she still makes a lot of mistakes.

She is voiced by [[Sasaki Nozomi]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Maid

h4. Appearance

* !post #2481814
* !post #3481418: [[felicia (picnic) (fire emblem)|Picnic]]

title: azura_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Azura[/b] (アクア Akua, Aqua) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She is the opposite of [[corrin (fire emblem)|Corrin]] (the Avatar), having been born in Nohr but kidnapped and raised in Hoshido. After she meets the protagonist, she travels with them no matter what choice they make. She holds a special power in the songs she sings.

She is voiced by Lynn in the Japanese version. Her singing voice is provided by Renka. In the English localization, Rena Strober provides both her voice acting and singing.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Songstress

h4. Appearance

title: class_d51
body:
The Class D51 (D51形) is a type of 2-8-2 [[steam locomotive|steam]] [[locomotive]] built by the [[Japan Railways|Japanese Government Railways]] ([[Japan Railways|JGR]]), the [[Japan Railways|Japanese National Railways]] ([[Japan Railways|JNR]]), and Kawasaki Heavy Industries Rolling Stock Company, Kisha Seizo, Hitachi, Nippon Sharyo, Mitsubishi, and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries from 1936 to 1945 and 1950 to 1951. 174 units are in preservation in Japan, including five operational examples. A further 13 are preserved in Russia and Taiwan, bringing the total number of preserved units to 187.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23073815: D51 Steam Locomotive
* !asset #23073832: D51 in freight operation of the JNR days
* !asset #23073836: D51 Semi-Streamlined Variant
* !asset #25084809: D51 Streamlined Variant
* !post #6834291: Goto Factory Smoke Deflector 

h4. See also

* [[Japan Railways]]
* [[East Japan Railway Company]]
* [[West Japan Railway Company]]
* [[Steam Locomotive]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: JNR Class D51":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JNR_Class_D51

If a locomotive is capable of carrying a payload, it is usually rather referred to as a [[Multiple Unit Train|multiple unit]]

The Devil traditionally takes the form of a [[demon|demonic]] figure, usually with mixed human and bestial features. In some decks, the Devil stands or squats atop a pedestal to which nude male and female humanoid demons are chained.

Death is traditionally represented by a [[skeleton|skeletal]] figure, often carrying a [[scythe]] like the classic [[Grim Reaper]]. In some decks, Death rides a horse and carries a black [[flag|standard]] with a white rose.

body:
The twelfth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Hanged Man is almost always a figure suspended [[upside-down]] by one ankle, usually with the other leg bent to resemble the numeral 4. Despite their situation, they typically have a [[expressionless|calm or stoic]] facial expression.

title: mushoku_tensei
body:
Full title: 無職転生 〜異世界行ったら本気だす〜 ([i]Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu[/i], lit. [i]Jobless Reincarnation: I Will Seriously Try If I Go to Another World[/i]).

An isekai light novel series about a jobless and hopeless man who reincarnates in a fantasy world while keeping his memories, determined to live his new life without regrets. Illustrated by [[Shirotaka (5choume)|]].

A manga adaptation began serialization in June 2014. An anime adaptation premiered in January 2021.

title: skrunkly_(rin_penrose)
body:
[[Rin Penrose]]'s fan [[mascot]]. It is a small, round creature with stubby arms and a [[beak]]. Described by Rin as "fully customizable," its appearance varies greatly. In its default form, it wears a [[blue_coat|blue]] and [[pink coat]] which covers everything but its face.

title: the_hierophant_(tarot)
body:
The fifth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Hierophant is usually drawn in religious garb with a [[mitre]] and holding a triple [[cross]], traditionally associated with the [[pope]]. Symbolic depictions of the Hierophant show him on a [[throne]] between two pillars, with worshipers at his feet.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Hierophant Green ]] ([[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] [[Stardust Crusaders]])
* [[Margot Brightcross]] ([[Gen'ei ni Mau Hakugin]])
* [[Aragaki Shinjirou]], [[Kitamura Bunkichi]] & [[Kitamura Mitsuko|Mitsuko]] ([[Persona 3]])
* [[Doujima Ryoutarou]] ([[Persona 4]])
* [[Sakura Soujirou]] ([[Persona 5]])

* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_emperor_(tarot)
body:
The fourth of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Emperor wears a [[crown]] and sits on a [[throne]] decorated with [[sheep|rams']] heads. He may be holding a [[scepter]] and/or a [[globe]].

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Emperor (stand)|Empror]] ([[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] [[Stardust Crusaders]])
* [[Vanessa di Falcone]] ([[Gen'ei ni Mau Hakugin]])
* [[Sanada Akihiko]], [[Odagiri Hidetoshi]] ([[Persona 3]])
* [[Tatsumi Kanji]] ([[Persona 4]])
* [[Kitagawa Yuusuke]] ([[Persona 5]])
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_empress_(tarot)
body:
The third of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The Empress is traditionally a woman seated on a [[throne]], wearing a monarch's [[crown]] and holding a [[scepter]]. In many decks, the Empress is [[pregnant]]. Her throne may be situated in a [[field]] of grain or lush vegetation.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Empress (stand)|Empress]] ([[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] [[Stardust Crusaders]])
* [[Yuuki Maria]] ([[Gen'ei ni Mau Hakugin]])
* [[Kirijou Mitsuru]] ([[Persona 3]])
* [[Margaret (Persona)|Margaret]] ([[Persona 4]])
* [[Okumura Haru]] ([[Persona 5]])

* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_high_priestess_(tarot)
body:
The second of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

In older tarot decks designed for card games, the High Priestess is [i]La Papesse[/i], a female [[pope]]. Occult tarot decks surround the High Priestess with esoteric symbolism; she wears a crown like that of the goddess [[hathor_(mythology)|Hathor]], she sits between "two pillars labeled B and J":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boaz_and_Jachin, she holds a [[book]] or [[scroll]], and the [[moon]] is at her feet.

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[High Priestess (stand)|High Priestess]] ([[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] [[Stardust Crusaders]])
* [[Mireille Sumeragi]] ([[Gen'ei ni Mau Hakugin]])
* [[Yamagishi Fuuka]] ([[Persona 3]])
* [[Amagi Yukiko]] ([[Persona 4]])
* [[Niijima Makoto]] ([[Persona 5]])

* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: green_channel
body: A satelite TV channel in Japan. Wholly owned by the [[Japan Racing Association]], the channel focuses on all things horse racing, from broadcasting JRA horse races, interviews of individuals related to horse racing, and even running reruns of horse racing themed animes such as [i][[Midori no Makibaoo]][/i] and [i][[Gunjou no Fanfare]][/i].

title: dante_(limbus_company)
body:
The main protagonist and player character of [[Limbus Company]].

Sinner No.10 of [[Limbus Company]] and the executive manager. Based off of the protagonist and author of the 14th century poem "The Divine Comedy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Divine_Comedy written by Italian poet "Dante Aligheiri":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dante_Alighieri.

Their [[object head|head]] has been replaced with a red [[clock]] permanently on [[fire]] styled after the "Doomsday Clock":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doomsday_Clock. Unlike other sinners, their uniform consists of a unique [[red coat]] and [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]] in addition to the standard [[red necktie]], [[black pants]] but excludes the [[black vest]] and wears an additional pair of [[black gloves]].

If their gender isn't readily apparent within the image, tag them as [[1other]].
h1. Official art
* !post #5028599

title: king_candy
body:
The ruler of the fictional video game Sugar Rush, seen in [i]Wreck-It Ralph[/i].

[spoiler]
He is actually Turbo, the star of a 1980s racing game that became jealous when a new game, [i]RoadBlasters[/i], was introduced to the arcade. He infiltrated the new game and caused it to crash, leading to both games being unplugged.
[/spoiler]

title: sodashi_(racehorse)
body:
Real-Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Kurofune (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Buchiko. Sodashi is famous for being the first white horse in the world to be a winner of a G1 race at the 2020 Hanshin Juvenile Fillies. She was also winner of the 2021 Oka Sho and the 2022 Victoria Mile. She is one of the dominant fillies of the 2021 generation, along with [[Uberleben (racehorse)|]] (2021 Oaks) and [[Akaitorino Musume (racehorse)|]] (2021 Shuka Sho).

Sodashi is a white mare featuring an almost uniformly white coat with a few spots of dark skin around her eyes. She ran either with a white or owner-colored hood ("Kaneko" colors: black with a yellow top third and a zig-zag pattern, with blue ears).

She retired on October 1st 2023 due to leg issues, passing the torch to her little sister [[Mama Cocha (racehorse)|]], who had recently won that year's Sprinter Stakes.
On January 30th 2025 (but with the news released 2 weeks later), she gave birth to her first child, a (presumed*) dark bay filly with a peculiarly-shaped facial marking sired by [[Equinox (racehorse)|]].

[tn]* Presumed due to the fact that Sodashi might actually be gray under her white coat, thanks to her sire, Kurofune.[/tn]

h4. See Also
* [[Imanami Takatoshi]] - Groom
* [[Gold Ship (Racehorse)|]] - Senpai horse of the [[Sugai Naosuke|Sugai]] stable, with them sharing the same groom
* [[Mama Cocha (Racehorse)|]] - Non-White Full Younger Sister
* [[Meikei Yell (Racehorse)|]] - Contemporary and Non-White Cousin
* [[Hayayakko (Racehorse)|]] - Cousin also notable for his firsts (First white horse with graded wins on both turf and dirt)

title: boomerang_mario
body: An alternate form [[Mario]] takes on when using a [[boomerang flower]]. In this form, he wears a blue [[turtle shell]] like that of a [[Boomerang_Bro]] and wears a [[blue hat|blue]] [[helmet]] with a red [[visor cap]] underneath. He also wears [[red pants]] and a [[blue footwear|blue version]] of his normal [[shoes]]. Typically seen wielding a [[boomerang]].

title: bodysuit
body:
A [[skin tight]], one-piece garment that covers the body from the neck to at least the upper legs.

Note that it has to be one piece of clothing, not separate pieces of clothing, such as a [[leotard]] over a pair of [[pantyhose]].

If it covers only the upper body and not the legs, like a one-piece swimsuit, use [[leotard]] instead. If the fabric is obviously sheer or thin, use [[bodystocking]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #321303
* !post #2340198

h4. Non-examples

title: warship_girls_r
body:
[b]Warship Girls R[/b] (战舰少女 [i]Zhan Jian Shao Nyu[/i]) is a shipgirl-themed Chinese smartphone game.

Gameplay is similar to [[Kantai Collection]]. However, unlike [[Kantai Collection]], where most of the ships originally came from the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], Warship Girls R from the start featured ships from various naval forces around the world. 

h4. History

The game was initially released by "Suzhou Paiqu Network Technology":[http://www.p7game.com/], as Warship Girls, for Android and iOS devices in September, 2014.

In July 2015 there was a split between the publisher of the game and its developer, MoeFantasy (幻萌), and from then on each company developed and released its own version of the game, which differed in available characters, interface design, etc.

On August 29th 2015 at ComiCon16, Shanghai, MoeFantasy revealed via trailer the development of [i]Project R[/i], a major overhaul of the game including new features, updated UI and a new animated combat system. This version was released in November the same year as client version 2.0 and was dubbed 战舰少女R (Warship Girls R). The MoeFantasy version would become the main focus of all community efforts, from wikis to drop data libraries and fan works.

On June 23rd 2016, it was announced on the community's Baidu forum and later as official statements that a settlement had been reached between the two companies. SPNT shut down its servers on September in the same year.

On October 24th 2017, a Japanese translated version and server released under the name 戦艦少女R, or Senkan Shoujo R.

On December 18th 2018, a Global server and Korean server were officially released.

Also in 2018, on September 8th, a spinoff was released that was made by MoeFantasy's Japanese branch, entitled 蒼青のミラージュ or [[steelblue mirage|MiST: The Mirage of Steelblue]]. Due to various reasons, it became unavailable on March 15th, 2020, with refunds beginning at the same time, ending on June 15th.

The Global server and Korean server were shut down on the 31st of August, 2021.

h4. See also

* [[Kantai Collection]]
* [[Azur Lane]]
* [[Blue Oath]]
* [[Victory Belles]]
* [[Remodel (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[List of Warship Girls R characters]]

title: water_rocket
body:
A water rocket is a type of model rocket that uses water as its reaction mass. The water is forced out via a pressurized gas, typically compressed air.  These kinds of rockets are frequently constructed out of [[plastic bottle]]s, which is why these kinds of rockets are also known as "bottle rockets."

* !post #1992243

title: mouth_mask
body:
A [[mask]] that covers only the nose and mouth. [[Surgical mask]]s and [[ninja mask]]s are common types of mouth masks.

They became required or recommended in much of the world during the [[coronavirus pandemic]].

For face masks used for skincare, see [[beauty mask]].

title: karyl_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from Princess Connect! Re:Dive (she did not appear in the original [[Princess Connect!]]). She also appears in [[Granblue Fantasy]] as a special event character, and in [[Shadowverse]] as both a card ("Karyl, Catty Sorceress") and a leader.

Karyl is Cygames' official localization of her name, but it may be spelled "Kyaru" or "Cal" by fans.

[spoiler]Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[Karyl (real) (princess connect!)|Momochi Kiruya]] (百地希留耶).[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Tachibana Rika]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3343966: Default
* !post #5893088: [[Karyl (summer) (princess connect!)|Summer Karyl]]
* !post #5893092: [[Karyl (new year) (princess connect!)|New Years' Karyl]]

* !asset #20234275: [[Karyl (overload) (princess connect!)|Overload Karyl]]
* !asset #20234253: [[Karyl (transfer student) (princess connect!)|Transfer Student Karyl]]

title: pezun_dwadge
body:
A fictional manned combat giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It was introduced in the original design series [[Gundam MS-X]].
 
[b]MS-10 Pezun Dowadge[/b]

An experimental high mobility [[mobile suit]] developed at the [[asteroid]] base [i]Pezun[/i] as part of the secretive "[[Zeon]] Pezun Project". It was a direct successor to the [[dom_(mobile_suit)|MS-09 Dom]]. 

The Pezun Dowadge's relationship with the similarly-named MS-09G [[Dwadge]] remains uncertain to this day.

title: elle_(tenchi_souzou)
body:
Support character in [[Tenchi souzou]] (also localized as Terranigma).

She is a [[1girl|girl]] with [[pink hair]] wearing a [[multicolored dress]].

title: kuromajo-san_ga_tooru!!
body:
黒魔女さんが通る!!, lit. [i]The Black Witch Appears!![/i] is a Japanese children's novel series written by Ishizaki Hiroshi and illustrated by [[Fujita Kaori]]. The series was launched on Kodansha's Aoi Tori Denki imprint from 1980, releasing 15 volumes during its run. A television anime adaptation by Shin-Ei Animation began airing in Japan from April 4, 2012.

Whilst joining her friends in an occult session to find out which girl a boy likes, [[Kurotori Chiyoko]] attempts to summon the messenger of love, Cupid. However, due to having a stuffed nose at the time, she inadvertently summons a black witch named [[Gyubid]], who decides to train Chiyoko to become a black witch herself.

h4. Characters

* [[Gyubid]]
* [[Ichiro Mai]]
* [[Kurotori Chiyoko]]
* [[Miyase Touko]]
* [[Mukai Rio]]
* [[Ramon Ruru]]
* [[Shion Megu]]
* [[Touka Blossom]]

h4. External links

* "Official Anime Website":http://www.shin-ei-animation.jp/kuromajyo/
* "Wikipedia: Kuromajo-san ga Toru!!":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuromajo-san_ga_Toru!!]
