title: help:blacklists
body:
[b]Blacklists[/b] are a way to hide posts containing tags you don't want to see.

To edit your blacklist, go to your "account settings":[/settings] under [b]My Account[/b] >> [b]Settings[/b] >> [b]Basic[/b]. You'll have to "create an account":[/users/new] if you don't have one already. In the [b]Blacklisted tags[/b] box, add the list of tags you want to hide.

Blacklisted posts are hidden during searches. When posts are hidden, a Blacklist option will appear in the sidebar showing you how many posts were hidden. You can click the tags under the Blacklist section to unhide blacklisted posts.

[[help:safe mode|Safe mode]] is another option if you just want to hide non-{{rating:general}} posts.

h4. Examples

Each rule goes on a separate line:

[code]
yaoi
futanari
guro
spoilers
[/code]
This will hide all posts that are tagged either [[yaoi]], [[guro]], or [[spoilers]].

If you put multiple tags on one line, then only posts that have [b]all[/b] the tags will be hidden:

[code]
yaoi guro
[/code]

This will only hide posts that are tagged both [[yaoi]] and [[guro]]. Posts that are tagged only [[yaoi]] or only [[guro]] will still be visible.

[code]yaoi 2boys
1boy[/code]

This will hide all posts that are tagged both tag [[yaoi]] and [[2boys]], also hide [[1boy]].

h6. NOT operator

The [code]-[/code] symbol is the NOT operator. It lets you hide posts that [b]don't[/b] have certain tags.

[code]
nude 1boy -1girl -multiple_girls
[/code]

This will hide all posts that are tagged [[nude]] and [[1boy]], but only if they don't have the tags [[1girl]] or [[multiple girls]].

h6. OR operator

The [code]~[/code] symbol is the OR operator. It lets you hide posts that have [b]any[/b] of the given tags.

[code]
~1boy ~2boys
[/code]

is the same as:

[code]
1boy
2boys
[/code]

This can also be used to group together multiple complex rules into a single rule:

[code]
1boy -1girl -multiple_girls
2boys -1girl -multiple_girls
[/code]

is the same as

[code]
~1boy ~2boys -1girl -multiple_girls
[/code]

h6. Metatags

There are a few special commands, known as metatags, that can be used to blacklist things other than regular tags:

* {{rating:explicit}}
* {{rating:questionable}}
* {{rating:sensitive}}
* {{rating:general}}
* {{status:pending}}
* {{status:flagged}}
* {{status:deleted}}
* {{score:<-5}} ([i]only less-than comparisons allowed[/i])
* uploaderid:1234 ([i]must be a user id[/i])

h6. Limitations

Wildcards are not allowed within blacklists. For example, using {{*boys}} to match the {{2boys}}, {{3boys}}, etc., tags won't work.

h4. Default Blacklists

The following blacklist is automatically set for logged out users and new users:

[code]
guro
scat
furry -rating:g
[/code]

h4. See also

* [[help:user settings]]
* [[help:safe mode]]

title: among_us
body:
A social intrigue party game developed and published in 2018 by InnerSloth, in which players are randomly divided into [[Crewmate (among us)|]]s and  [[Impostor (among us)|]]s. The Crewmates must attempt to complete all required tasks and/or expose the Impostors, while the secret Impostors must [[murder]] or frame the Crewmates or sabotage the Crewmates' efforts.

Although released in 2018 as a relatively little-known game, it had a sudden boom in popularity in September 2020, with regular concurrent numbers of well over 250,000, reaching widespread [[meme|memetic]] fame. The game would later spawn a wide variety of post-ironic [[meme|memes]] a year later, usually revolving around a parody of [[Stonetoss (style)|]] comics, a [[when the imposter is sus (meme)|photoshopped image]] of [[Jerma985]], anything that looks like the in-game characters and/or having the name sounded like "Among Us/Amogus" or "Sus", or simply using the in-game character itself as a "punchline".

title: hop_on_among_us_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a Tumblr image of [[yuri|two anime girls]] [[kiss]]ing with the caption "Hop on [[Among Us]]". The phrase took on a double meaning as an ironic slang term used to ask someone if they want to have gay sex, essentially calling the game's players "gay,"

The meme later spawned numerous derivatives involving an image or [[animated GIF]] of either a [[yaoi|gay]] or [[yuri|lesbian]] couple kissing with the name of the targeted game (and fanbase) being changed accordingly.

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme: Hop On Among Us":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/hop-on-among-us

title: renaissance
body:
Generally known as "The Renaissance". The period of European history from around 1450-1600, when knowledge of and interest in classic Greek and Roman art and literature flourished and led to massive changes in European art and literature, predominately in Italy and France but also seen in England, Spain and the Holy Roman Empire (modern Germany).

Some of the larger names associated with this period are Leonardo da Vinci, Michaelangelo and William Shakespeare. The word comes from the French word for "rebirth".

title: yhwach
body:
Major antagonist of the manga/anime series [[Bleach]].

He is the leader of the Wandenreich as well as the son of the [[Soul King|Adnyeus]], aka "Soul King". Yhwach sought to destroy his father and the Soul Society in order to create a united world where mortality is no longer a concept under his rule.

title: aizen_sousuke

The main antagonist of the manga/anime series [[Bleach]].

Originally the former Shinigami captain of the 5th Division of Gotei 13, who attempted to overthrow the King of Soul Society. He was defeated by [[Kurosaki Ichigo]] and was imprisoned at Muken for his crimes of treason.

title: mona_lisa
body:
[b]Mona Lisa[/b] (a.k.a. [b]Gioconda[/b]) is a painting by [[Leonardo da Vinci]]. Painted during the Italian [[Renaissance]], it is a 16th-century [[portrait]] painted in oil on a poplar panel. 

The painting is a half-length portrait and depicts a woman whose expression is often described as enigmatic. Its atmospheric and novel qualities continue to fascinate people, and has inspired many parodies.

h4. Example

* !asset #24829296

h4. See also 

* [[fine art parody]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mona Lisa":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mona_Lisa]

title: project_diva_(series)
body:
h4. SEGA feat. HATSUNE MIKU Project

h6. 初音ミク -Project DIVA-

A series of Rhythm Action games published by [[SEGA]] featuring [[Hatsune Miku]] and her fellow Crypton [[Vocaloid]]s. These games were released on the [[PlayStation Portable]], [[Playstation Vita]], and [[Playstation 3]].

Project DIVA is a simple rhythm game where you tap/hold buttons corresponding to icons on the screen while listening to various Vocaloid songs. You can dress each Vocaloid in unique [[list_of_project_diva_modules|Modules]] (costumes) to dance in during each song, which you must unlock by clearing different conditions depending on the module. When not playing the rhythm games, you can view songs in PV mode, or interact with the Vocaloids themselves in the DIVA Room.

Use of this tag alone is allowed for images that reference Project DIVA in some way, but do not depict modules from any of the games. Please do not include the {{Vocaloid}} tag if the image does not include any Vocaloid characters in it.

h6.Examples:
* post #819162 and post #1244598, resembles/parodies the game's interface or rhythm game icons
* post #912808, a controller designed specifically for Project DIVA
* post #1014359, parodies or use of the Project DIVA logo/name

h5.Games
* [[project diva|Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA-]]
* [[project diva 2nd|Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- 2nd]]
* [[project diva extend|Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- extend]]
* [[project diva f|Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- f/F]]
* [[project diva f 2nd|Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- F2nd]]
* [[project diva x|Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- X]]
* [[project diva mega39's|Hatsune Miku Project DIVA MEGA39's]]

h4. See also

title: hercule_poirot
body:
[b]Hercule Poirot[/b] is a fictional Belgian Detective created by British writer Agatha Christie. He is Agatha's most famous and longest-running character, appearing in 33 novels, two plays and 51 short stories published between 1920 and 1975.

In the novels, Hercule is a former police detective for the Belgian Police before being forced to move to Britain after his country was invaded by Germany during [[World War I]]. After settling in his new home country, Poirot becomes a private detective who offers his services to solve cases and murders throughout Britain and abroad. Other recurring characters in the novels include Captain Arthur Hastings, a former British Army officer and Poirot's companion, Mrs Ariadne Oliver, a detective novelist whose a humorous self-caricature of Agatha herself, Miss Felicity Lemon, Poirot's secretary and Chief Inspector James Harold Japp of Scotland Yard, who often hires Poirot in difficult cases.

The Poirot novels has been adapted many times with the most famous being the ITV series [I]Agatha Christie's Poirot[/I], which ran from 1989 to 2013 with David Suchet as Poirot, whose portrayal as the character being the most well received. A 39 episodes anime adaptation of the novels, [[agatha christie no meitantei poirot to marple|Agatha Christie's Great Detectives Poirot and Marple]], aired from 4 July 2004 to 15 May 2005 on NHK. Currently there is a Hercule Poirot film series directed by Kenneth Branagh with Poirot portrayed by Kenneth himself. As of 2025, Kenneth has directed three Poirot films, Murder on the Orient Express (2017), Death on the Nile (2022) and A Haunting in Venice (2023).

title: armored_core_vi:_fires_of_rubicon
body:
[b]Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon[/b], is a mecha combat videogame by From Software and published by Bandai Namco. The sixth game of the [[Armored Core]] series and latest since 2013's [[Armored Core: Verdict Day]], the game was released on 25 August 2023 on for PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, PC, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X/S.

Set in the far future on the planet Rubicon 3, the planet was once rich with a substance called Coral that could be use as an energy source and data conduit. However, the Coral caused a cataclysmic event known as the Fires of Ibis, which engulfed the planet and the surrounding star system in flames. Fifty years later, Coral was once again discovered on Rubicon 3, leading to a war between the Corporations who want to mine Coral and the local government and people trying to stop them.

The player takes the role of [[621 (armored core vi)|621]], an augmented Armored Core pilot sent to Rubicon 3 by their boss, [[Handler Walter]], to work as a mercenary for the various factions in order to earn a new life for themselves.

h4. See also
* [[List of Armored Core VI characters and Mechanics]]

title: ewac_zack
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]].

[b]RMS-119 EWAC Zack ("Eye-Zack")[/b]

It is an aggressive reconnaisance variant of the [[titans_(Gundam)|Titans]] [[Hizack]] [[mobile suit]] equipped with a [[radome]].

After the end of [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps War]] some units were captured and used by [[Neo Zeon]] with [[gundam_zz|blue]] and [[gundam_unicorn|grey]] colors.

title: armbar
body:
The armbar or the jūji-gatame (十字固, rendered as "Ude-Hishigi-Juji-Gatame") is an official Kodokan [[Judo]] technique. 

The English word "bar" is used here to signify the opponent's extended arm, while the Japanese word "jūji" (十字) refers to the armbar's visual resemblance to the number 10 as written in kanji, 十. The word jūji is also found in "jūjika" (十字架), meaning a cross.
 
In general, the practitioner secures an arm at the wrist of the opponent, trapping it by squeezing the knees together. The attacker's legs end up across the opponent's chest, with the arm held between the thighs, with the elbow pointing against the thigh or hips. By holding the opponent's wrist to the attacker's chest with the pinky finger on the sternum and the thumb facing up (arm semi-supinated or semi-pronated), the practitioner can easily extend the opponent's arm and hyperextend the opponent's elbow. The attacker can further increase the pressure on the elbow joint by arching their hips against the elbow.

h4. See also
* [[judo]]
* [[martial arts]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armlock]

title: fiamma_of_the_right
body:
Fiamma of the Right (Uhō no Fianma) is the final member and leader of God's Right Seat and the main antagonist of the magic side in the Toaru Majutsu no Index Light Novels. 

His name is derived from the Italian name for flame, "Fiamma."

title: geminus
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[Gundam Evolve]].

[b]QRX-006 Geminus[/b]

A powerful, romboid shaped experimental [[mobile armor]] originally developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. It is armed with devastating beam weapons and can transform into a giant humanoid form.

title: brendan_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Brendan[/b], known as [b]Yuuki[/b] (ユウキ) in Japan, is the male player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

His goal is to be like his dad, Norman—a Gym Leader he really looks up to. He is a bit mischievous, but he is serious about Pokémon battles [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

In his [[pokemon oras|ORAS]] outfit, he has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair|hair]]. He wears a [[white hat|white]] [[beanie|hat]], a [[tight shirt|tight]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[turtleneck]] shirt with a [[zipper pull tab|zipper pull]], a [[bracelet]], [[black pants|black]] [[capri pants|pants]], [[white footwear|white]] and [[green footwear|green]] [[sneakers|shoes]], and a [[green bag|green]] [[backpack]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Ruby[/b] who has [[red eyes]], sometimes wears [[glasses]] and hides claw-shaped [[scar|scars]] on his forehead under his hat.

title: anglerfish
body:
A bony [[fish]] from the order [b]Lophiiformes[/b] named for the fleshy growth on its head that it uses to [[lure]] in prey.

Well known types of anglerfishes include the deep sea anglerfish, the frogfish, and the sea toad.

title: samba_de_amigo
body: A rhythm game series developed by Sonic Team and published by Sega. In the game, players use maracas—special controllers that resemble the musical instrument—to shake in time with Latin music tracks, following on-screen prompts to match the rhythm.

title: domino_(pokemon)
body:
A member of [[Team Rocket]] who appeared in the Pokemon TV special [i]Mewtwo Returns[/i] as its secondary antagonist.

She has [[blonde hair]] that she styles in [[twin drills]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears the [[Team Rocket uniform]] with her [[black shirt]] complemented by [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white boots|white]] [[thigh boots]], and [[white skirt]]. She wears a [[belt]] with front-facing [[belt buckle]]. Her hat is mostly [[pink hat|pink]], but the front panel is white. Her code name is Black Tulip, so she sometimes is depicted with a [[black tulip]].

title: cecil_carna
body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|Rance]] series, introduced in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and reintroduced in [[Rance x]].

In [[Kichikuou Rance]], Cecil is a mercenary employed by [[Pluepet]], who can be hired by [[Rance]] for gold. She cannot be called into his harem, however, making Cecil one of the few women without any sexual content involving her.

In [[Rance x]], she is an independent leader of a Mercenary Guild who leads the defense of the Free Cities Alliance, and the lover of [[Arios Theoman]].

title: la_hawzel
body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|]] series, introduced in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and returns in [[Rance x]].

A former [[Angel]], La Hawzel is a Dark Lord affiliated with the [[Hornet (rance)|]] Faction, and the twin sister of [[La Seizel]], who is affiliated with the [[Kayblis]] Faction. Unlike her volatile, selfish sister, Hawzel is calm, compassionate, and close friends with Hornet.

title: kayblis
body: A main antagonist in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and [[Rance x]]. The oldest and most powerful Dark Lord in the Rance world, he is a grotesque, deer-like figure possessing six arms and eight penises. He, alongside his faction, schemes to usurp [[Hornet (Rance)|]] and kill [[Kurusu Miki]] to become the Demon King, and rule all of Monsterkind.

title: hawlean_province
body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|Rance series]], introduced in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and reintroduced in [[Rance x]].

In both games, Hawlean (or Haurein in the English version) is a strict, dutiful commander of the Leazas White Army, and the estranged daughter of [[Barres Province]]. In [i]Kichikuou[/i], she participates in the rebellion against King [[Rance]] at the start of the game, led by her superior [[Ex Banquet]].
other_names: ハウレーン・プロヴァンス

title: lei_gatthon
body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|Rance series]], introduced in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and later revamped for [[Rance x]].

In [[Kichikuou Rance]], Lei is an aloof Dark Lord affiliated with the [[Kayblis]] Faction, who possesses a romantic relationship with an elderly woman named [[Mary Ann (Rance)|]]. Depending on the player's actions, Lei can be killed by holding Mary Ann hostage or by fighting him directly.

In [[Rance x]], while Lei remains as a member of the Kayblis Faction, his relationship with Mary Ann is significantly altered. In this game, Lei meets Mary Ann as a child and befriends her, and does not become romantically involved with her until she reaches adulthood in Part 2. The player is also given the option to spare and recruit Lei, unlike in [i]Kichikuou[/i]

body:

title: yuki_miku_(2024)
body:
冬のごちそうVer. / [i]Winter Feast Ver.[/i]

The 2024 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest for this year was ごちそう (feast) showing the imagery of Hokkaido winter with the winner being [[shiro_(a923808254)|shiro]]'s design with a [[soup curry]] theme.

Her design has a [[sepia]] palette. She wears a [[brown kimono]] with [[kappougi]], [[white bow]], and [[fork hair ornament|fork]]/[[spoon hair ornament]]. Her kappougi is adorned with [[button badge]]s of the common ingredients for soup curry: [[hardboiled egg]], [[carrot]], [[lotus root]], [[green pepper|green]] [[bell pepper]], and [[squash]].

Her theme song is [[Happy Cheat Day (vocaloid)|]] by rerulili, with arrangement by tepe, mastering by kagomeP, animation by [[kawa (ricopin35)|]], and movie by [[nihe (niheranone)|]].

Her fan nickname is Soup Curry-chan.

body:
[[Rice Deity]]'s submission for the [[Yuki Miku (2024)]] design contest, featuring a [[chef]] with a [[shrimp]] motif wielding a [[cleaver]]. Although this design was not chosen to be one of the six finalists, she did gain a lot of popularity, especially among the Western fandom.

Her theme song is "You're Telling Me A SHRIMP Fried This Rice?!":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s742C0v5SFI] by Jamie Paige.

title: yuki_miku
body:
A winter-themed version of [[Hatsune Miku]] used for the annual SNOW MIKU event running concurrently with the [[Sapporo (city)|]] Snow Festival. There are [[snowflakes]] printed into her hair, and she wears an ice-blue outfit with parts done in glimmering silver. Her partner is a small white [[rabbit]] named [[Rabbit Yukine]].

Since 2012, there is a yearly contest to decide which fan-submitted design will be used as the official Yuki Miku of that year, the winner of which also gets their design turned into a Petite [[Nendoroid]] by [[Goodsmile Company]].

h4. Versions

* [[yuki miku (2010)|2010]] - Hatsune Miku's usual outfit colored to blue, white, and silver. 
* [[yuki miku (2011)|2011]] - Same outfit as the 2010 version, but given [[earmuffs]], a white [[scarf]], and white [[mittens]]. Now used as the default Yuki Miku.
* [[yuki miku (2012)|2012]] - "Fluffy Coat version" (ふわふわコートVer.): Wears a blue ribbon [[hairband]] and a coat with white [[fur trim]]. Has [[fur-trimmed boots]] to match.
* [[yuki miku (2013)|2013]] - "Strawberry White Dress version" (いちご白無垢Ver.): Wears a white kimono and [[uchikake]].
* [[yuki miku (2014)|2014]] - "Magical Snow version": Wears a [[witch hat]], a blue [[cape]], and wields a [[staff]].
* [[yuki miku (2015)|2015]] - "Snow Bell version": has a plant motif, wears a white [[bubble skirt]] and [[capelet]].
* [[yuki miku (2016)|2016]] - "Snow Owl version": Wears an owl-shaped [[hat]] and sports gear.
* [[yuki miku (2017)|2017]] - "Twinkle Snow version": Wields a [[wand]] and wears a sleeveless blue [[dress]].
* [[yuki miku (2018)|2018]] - "Crane Priestess version" (タンチョウ巫女Ver.): Has a crane-themed [[miko]] outfit with [[striped_legwear|striped]] [[thighhighs]].
* [[yuki miku (2019)|2019]] - "Princess version": Wields a [[scepter]] and wears a green and white [[frilled dress]], with a crystal [[tiara]], [[detached collar]], and equally as [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[juliet sleeves]].
* [[yuki miku (2020)|2020]] - "Snow Parade version": A [[band uniform]] motif with a [[french horn]], [[epaulettes]] that have a [[fringe trim]], and [[hat feather]].
* [[yuki miku (2021)|2021]] - "Glowing Snow version": A choir outfit with a clock motif featuring a [[clock print]] [[beret]] and [[white dress]].
* [[yuki miku (2022)|2022]] - "Grand Voyage version": A naval captain outfit with a crab motif featuring red [[hair ribbon]] that resemble crab claws and a [[fur-trimmed coat]].
* [[yuki miku (2023)|2023]] - "Serene Winter version": A pink and blue pastel palette [[kimono]] with a daybreak motif. She wields a [[giant brush]].
* [[yuki miku (2024)|2024]] - "Winter Feast version": A traditional [[Japanese clothes|Japanese outfit]] with a [[soup curry]] motif.
* [[yuki miku (2025)|2025]] - "Crystal Snow version": Carries an [[icicle]] [[wand]] and wears various winter-themed accessories, including [[icicle]], [[snowball]], and [[crystal|ice crystal]] [[hair ornament]]s.

h4. Appearance

title: racing_miku
body:
An alternate version of [[Hatsune Miku]] that serves as the mascot for [[GoodSmile Racing]].

[[Hatsune Miku]] receives a new design in a [[race queen]] theme for each racing season since 2009. The designs are officially acknowledged as "Racing Miku" (レーシングミク). The real life race queens for GoodSmile are known as the "Racing Miku Supporters" and wear outfits based on the Racing Miku design of the year.

The 2009 derivative is the only version of the Racing Miku derivatives which did not have an official illustration as per her release, though it was featured in merchandise for that season and new official arts have been given later on. The unveiling of the Racing Miku derivatives only became a feature from the 2010 season onwards. All merchandise related to Good Smile Racing featuring Miku prior to the 2010 season, with the exception of the 2009 Racing Miku figurine, features Miku in her normal attire.

title: asashimo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Asashimo[/i]. Character designed by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[grey hair|grey]] on the outside and [[purple hair|purple]] on the inside) and tied to a [[ponytail]], [[hair over one eye|hair covering her right eye]], [[grey eyes]], [[sharp teeth]], and [[small breasts]]. 

Her default outfit is the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[school uniform]] which consists of a purple [[halterneck]] [[dress]] over a [[white shirt]], a teal-blue [[bowtie]] and [[grey pantyhose|grey]]/[[purple pantyhose|purple]] opaque [[pantyhose]] with [[lace-up boots]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and mast as a backpack, a 12.7 cm twin gun mount, and 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

On her kai form, she gains a white [[headband]], AA guns and a [[single thighhigh]] on her left leg is overlaid on her pantyhose (emulating [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]] as an [[Operation Ten-Gou]] participant).

title: asashimo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The kai ni form of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Asashimo (kancolle)|]]. 

When it was first implemented on October 25, 2019, she first wore the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[winter uniform]]. It consists of a short grey [[blazer]] over the dress which now has a sheer black underskirt. Her pantyhose has also been reduced to [[thighhighs]] in the same seamed style. Her differing characteristics are that she the [[sleeves rolled up|sleeves of her blazer are slightly rolled up]] and she wears [[mismatched legwear|differently colored]] thighhighs, her right the standard [[grey thighhighs]] and her left [[black thighhigh|blackish/dark grey]]. 

She later gets the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[summer uniform]], consisting of a violet [[vest]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] blouse, a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] purple skirt with a sheer black underskirt, black gauntlet-like [[fingerless gloves]], and the abovementioned differently colored thighhighs.

title: jackie_quilt
body:
A playable character from [[Black Survival]]. A serial killer known for cutting her victims into so many pieces that one would need to stitch the remains together like a quilt to identify them. She willingly participates in Aglaia's experiments on Lumia Island, unlike many of the other Test Subjects, because it allows her to murder people without repercussions. Despite what her personality may suggest, she is considered [i]clinically sane[/i]. As a first-generation Test Subject, she is also immune to having her memories altered after each of Aglaia's experiments.

Has [[white hair]], [[red eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and is covered in [[scar]]s. Often wields a [[chainsaw]].

[spoilers]Her real name is Angela Winslair, and her parents were her first victims as a serial killer.[/spoilers]

title: son_goku
body:
The main protagonist of the [[Dragon Ball]] series. He is married to [[Chi-chi (dragon ball)|]] and has two sons named [[Son Gohan]] and [[Son Goten]].

Goku is a [[Saiyan]] born on planet Vegeta and raised on Earth. Capable of several different transformations including [[Kaiouken]], [[Super Saiyan]] [[Super Saiyan 1|1]], [[Super Saiyan 2|2]], [[Super Saiyan 3|3]], [[Super Saiyan 4|4]], [[Super Saiyan God]], [[Super Saiyan Blue]] and, ultimately, [[Ultra Instinct]].

His Saiyan name is "Kakarot", which is how [[Vegeta]] addresses him throughout the anime and manga. Some of his signature techniques are the [[Kamehameha (dragon ball)|]] and the [[Genki Dama]].

He is loosely based on [[Sun Wukong]] of the classical Chinese novel [i][[Journey to the West]][/i], whose name is translated as Son Goku in Japanese.

Goku's Japanese seiyuu is [[Nozawa Masako]], the current English dub voice actor is [[Sean Schemmel]] (though the character has gone through many different dub voice changes in the past), and his Latin American dub voice actor is Mario Castañeda.

In the early series, he possesses the [[ruyi jingu bang|Power Pole]] and the [[Flying Nimbus]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4797300: Default ([[Dragon Ball Z|Z]], [[Dragon Ball Super|Super]], et al) [with [[Vegeta]]]

title: threo_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character and one of the Eternals. Her name in Japanese is "Saraasa" or "thalaatha/ثلاثة", which is Arabic for "three".

Wielder of the Three Tiger Axe, a fierce warrior who understands the laws of nature which is her creed. Born and raised away from human civilization, Threo relies mostly on her natural instincts and senses whether in and out of combat. This trait and her mentality and desire to become stronger to "reach the top of the food chain" even caused her peers to compare her to a wild beast.

Voiced by [[Takayama Minami]].

h4. Appearance

title: cable_(marvel)
body: [b]Cable[/b], a.k.a. [b]Nathan Christopher Charles Summers[/b] or [b]Nathan Dayspring[/b], is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]], commonly in association with X-Force and the [[X-Men]]. Nathan first appeared as the newborn son of [[Scott Summers]] and [[Madelyne Pryor]] in The Uncanny X-Men #201 (Jan. 1986) created by writer Chris Claremont and penciler Rick Leonardi, while Cable first appeared in The New Mutants #87 (March 1990) created by writer Louise Simonson and artist/co-writer [[Rob Liefeld]]. Cable's origin initially was undecided and he was assumed to be a separate character, but it was later decided that he was actually an older version of Nathan due to being a time traveler.

title: ullrid_(girls'_frontline_2)
body:
An android in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]]. She wields a [[sword]] as her primary weapon and a [[bow (weapon)|]] as a secondary weapon. Voiced by [[Saito Yuka]].

The leader of the Doll Community, an independent self-governing group of dolls surviving in the irradiated Yellow Zone, Ullrid is very close to [[Littara (girls' frontline 2)|]], who she treats as a close confidant, and [[Suomi (girls' frontline 2)|]], who she treats as a younger sister. While she typically comes off as a calm and collected older sister, those close to her are aware of her self-doubts and deep underlying frustrations with herself. To deal with stress, Ullrid heavily uses stress relief toys. Due to her past experiences, she isn't particularly trusting of humans.

h4. Appearance

body:
[b]Queen Emeraldas[/b]  is a four-episode Japanese anime OVA from 1998 that continues the [[Harlock Saga]] franchise created by [[Matsumoto Leiji]]. The anime was adapted from Matsumoto's 1978 manga of the same name. 

It is the story of the [[space]] [[pirate]] [[spacecraft]], [i]Queen Emeraldas[/i], which is captained by the mysterious and beautiful [[Emeraldas]].

title: mark_hamill
body:
[b]Mark Richard Hamill[/b] (b. September 25, 1951)

American actor and [[voice actor]].

Became famous for portraying the character of [[Luke Skywalker]] in the [[Star Wars]] [[science fiction|space opera]] movie franchise in his youth during the 70s and 80s, a role he returned to play during the new sequel trilogy of films (and net series) produced by [[Disney]], he even played Luke in some parodies like [[Robot Chicken]] and [[Family Guy]].

Also a [[otaku|notable comic book collector]] and accomplished voice actor, quite popular for his role as the crazy [[DC comics]] villain [[Joker (dc)|]] in many animated series, movies and video games.

h4.Partial filmography
h6. Movies (live action)
* [[Star Wars: A New Hope|Star Wars Episode IV - A New Hope]]
* [[Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back|Star Wars Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back]]
* [[Star Wars: Return of the Jedi|Star Wars Episode VI - Return of the Jedi]]
* [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens|Star Wars Episode VII - The Force Awakens]]
* [[Star Wars: The Last Jedi|Star Wars Episode VIII - The Last Jedi]]

h6. Movies (Voice)

* [[Codename: Kids next door]]
* [[Avatar: The last airbender]]
* [[Regular Show]]

title: luke_skywalker
body:
Main protagonist of the original trilogy of [[Star Wars]] [[science fiction|Sci-Fi]] and [[Fantasy]] series.
 
He was played by American actor [[Mark Hamill]] in the three original films from the 70s and 80s and also in the new sequel trilogy of films and net series produced by [[Disney]].

Luke Skywalker is a farm boy from the backwater world of Tatooine who famously destroys the [[Death Star]] and becomes the Rebel Alliance's greatest hero. Under the guidance of [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Yoda]], Luke learns about his family as the son of fallen Jedi [[Anakin Skywalker]], and learns the ways of the Force, becoming a [[Jedi]] himself.
other_names: ルーク・スカイウォーカー
ルークスカイウォーカー

title: mon_mothma
body: Mon Mothma is a fictional character in the [[Star Wars]] franchise, primarily portrayed by Genevieve O'Reilly. Introduced as the leader of the Rebel Alliance in [[star wars: return of The Jedi|Return of the Jedi]] (1983), in which she is played by Caroline Blakiston, Mon has become a prominent character in subsequent prequel media, including the anthology film Rogue One (2016), the animated series [[star wars: the clone warS|The Clone Wars]] (2010) and [[star wars: rebels|Star Wars Rebels]] (2017), and the live-action television series Andor (2022–present). The character also appeared in the 2023 live-action television series Ahsoka, again portrayed by O'Reilly, her first time playing the character in sequel media set after Return of the Jedi.

title: don_quixote_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character. 

Sinner No.03 of [[Limbus Company]]. Based on and named after [[alonso quixano|the main protagonist]] of the 17th century Spanish novel [[Don Quixote (novel)|]] written by "Miguel de Cervantes":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miguel_de_Cervantes. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] kept in a [[bob cut]], [[yellow eyes]] that frequently [[+_+|sparkle]], and always wears a pair of worn [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]] with the name "Rocinante":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocinante across all of her identities. She wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black pants]], [[black coat]], but excludes the [[black vest]] and additionally adorns her uniform with various pins of famous fixers (Most notably [[iori (project moon)|The Purple Tear]]). 

She wields a towering [[polearm|joust]] in her base identity with the Spanish words 'SUEÑO IMPOSIBLE' ('IMPOSSIBLE DREAM' in English) written on it, the name of main theme song of [[Man of La Mancha]], the first official musical adaptation of Don Quixote.

[spoiler]She is revealed to be a second-generation Bloodfiend in Intervallo IV-2 after losing her shoes in a confrontation with [[Cassetti (project moon)|]]. Canto VII further reveals that she was formerly named [[Sancho (project moon)|]], having purposely wiped her memories by drinking from the River of Oblivion, suppressed her nature as a Bloodfiend with Rocinante, and adopted the name of the [[La Manchaland's Don Quixote (project moon)|First Kindred]] that sired her.[/spoiler]

h4. Official art

* !post #5026306

h4. See also
* [spoiler][[Sancho (project moon)|]][/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[La Manchaland's Don Quixote (project moon)|]][/spoiler]
* [[List of Project Moon characters]]

title: lay's_(potato_chips)
body:
Popular brand of [[potato chips]]. The brand is also referred to as Frito-Lay, as both Lay's and Fritos are brands sold by the Frito-Lay company, which has been a wholly owned subsidiary of PepsiCo since 1965.
Frito-Lay primarily uses the brand name "Lay's" in the United States, and uses other brand names in some other countries, including Walkers (UK and [[Ireland]]); Smith's ([[Australia]]); Chipsy ([[Egypt]] and the West Balkans); Tapuchips ([[Israel]]); Margarita ([[Colombia]]); and [[Sabritas]] ([[Mexico]]).

title: tsuma_shibori
body:
The third game in the [i][[Tsumamigui (Series)|]][/i] series by [[AliceSoft]], following [i][[Tsumamigui]][/i] and [i][[Tsumamigui 2]][/i]. Illustrated by [[Kuroda Akimi]].

h4. Characters

h6. Main Characters

* [[Shinba Kousuke]] （心羽幸助） - Main character.
* [[Aoi Sakura (Tsuma Shibori)|]] （葵咲良）- Older sister, married.
* [[Kotosuki Madoka]] （琴月まどか）- Younger sister.

h6. Sub-Heroines

* [[Takeuchi Himeka]] （竹内姫香）- Owner of the cafe.
* [[Izawa Ritsuko]] （伊澤律子）- Teacher.
* [[Tsubaki Yukie]] （椿雪絵）- Owner of sake bar, wife of Yoshiharu, mother of Kyouya.
* [[Miyamae Rumina]] （宮前るみな）- Genius kid.

h6. Competition

* [[Tsubaki Yoshiharu]] （椿良治）- Salary man, husband of Yukie, father of Kyouya.
* [[Tsubaki Kyouya]] （椿京弥）- Boy, son of Yoshiharu and Yukie.
* [[Yokosuka Saburou]] （横須賀三郎）- Middle age chubby man, owner of grocery store.

h6. Support characters

* [[Yasuzumi Daichi]] （安住大地）- Guy with messy hair, unshaved chin, and red shirt. Roommate of Kousuke up until Dec 16.
* [[Oohashi Keita]] （大橋圭太）- Good friend of Kousuke, blond guy with glasses, blue shirt.
* [[Akiyama Naotsugu]] （秋山直嗣）- PE Teacher, fiance of Ritsuko.

title: ultimate_spider-man_(2000)
body:
The original Ultimate Spider-Man comic run, which ran from 2000 to 2010. Ultimate Spider-Man was a reboot of the [[Spider-Man]] story within Marvel's Ultimate timeline, essentially retelling the original Amazing Spider-Man story in the 00s. 

In 2011 the series was relaunched as [b]Ultimate Comics: Spider-Man[/b] to coincide with the debut of [[Miles Morales]] as the new protagonist.

A [[ultimate spider-man|cartoon series]] of the same name began airing in 2012 but had little in common with the comics. Marvel launched a new [[Ultimate Spider-Man (2024)|]] series in 2024 as part of the new Ultimate Universe that was launched in 2023.

title: agano_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Agano[/i], the name ship of her class. Character design by [[Hecha (01964237)|]], voiced by [[Shiraishi Haruka (voice Actor)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied by a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] to a long [[ponytail]], with [[red eyes]]. She also wears a mix of traditional [[Japanese clothes]] (with prominent [[long sleeves]]), [[pantyhose]], and a [[black skirt]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of two 15.2 cm twin gun mounts and two 61 cm quadruple [[torpedo tubes]], one gun and torpedo mount on each side but her torpedoes are attached to her waist.

title: velcro
body:
Velcro (also known as a hook and loop fastener) is a fastening system consisting of a piece of fabric of small hooks that sticks to a corresponding fabric of small loops.  It produces a distinctive ripping sound when separating the two pieces.

Due to its ease of use compared to alternative fastening systems like [[buttons]] and [[zipper|zippers]], it is a common feature for clothing for [[child|children]], elderly, and the disabled who may have difficulty with laces, buttons, and zippers.

[i]Due to the prominence of the Velcro Brand, hook-and-loop fasteners are often referred to by the genericized trademark [b]velcro[/b] in English. Compare to adhesive bandage → [[bandaid]].[/i]

On 2024, a white version of the costume was revealed.

title: maribel_hearn
body:
A [[Touhou]] character (alt. spelling Maribel Han, or Maryberry Hearn; usually shortened to just Merry).

A girl living in the outside world with the ability to see borders of any kind, including the one which separates our world from [[Gensokyo]]. Along with [[Usami Renko]], she is the member of an Occult Club with the secret purpose of finding a way into Gensokyo.

Due to both characters having boundary-related abilities, as well as a degree of visual resemblance, fan theories abound about a possible connection between Maribel and [[Yakumo Yukari]], with some even going so far as to suggest that they are somehow the same person - the most common theory being that Maribel somehow cast herself backwards in time and ultimately aged into Yukari as she returned to her original era "the long way". [[ZUN]]'s own comments on the pair pointed fans towards the writer Lafcadio Hearn, who moved to Japan and was naturalized with the name Koizumi Yakumo.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Maribel Hearn":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Maribel_Hearn

title: kimetsu_no_yaiba
body:
A shonen manga by [[Gotouge Koyoharu]] published in [[shounen jump|Weekly Shonen Jump]] from 2016 to 2020.

Received an anime adaptation that ran from April 6th to September 28th, 2019, produced by [[ufotable]], under the name of [i]Blade of Demon Destruction[/i] or [i]Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba[/i], as well as a sequel movie [i]Mugen Train[/i].

Initially received lukewarm reception during its release, it has become one of the best-selling manga of all time after anime adaptation in 2019.

body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]No. 22[/i]. Nicknamed as "Fuufu." Character designed by [[Hozuka (kadokawa)|]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied into [[low twintails]], and [[blue eyes]]. 

Her uniform consists of a [[white dress|white]] puffy [[sailor dress]] with a [[blue sailor collar]] and [[puffy short sleeves]], and grey-red [[loafers]] in her historical hull colors. Her [[rigging]] consists of her hull piece slung to her right, a 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on her left wrist, [[depth charge]]s on her legs, [[thigh pouch]] on her left leg, and a handheld 120 mm single gun mount.

title: scale_armor
body:
[[Armor]] made of many small, overlapping plates sewn onto a cloth or leather backing, usually in a diamond pattern and/or resembling the [[scales]] of a fish or lizard.

Sometimes inaccurately referred to as scale mail.

Do not use this tag to refer to [[lamellar armor]], such as most Japanese armors, where the plates are perforated and stitched together in straight, ridged rows.

h4.  See also

* [[Lamellar armor]]
* [[Chainmail]]
* [[List of armor]]

title: tokusatsu
body:
Tokusatsu (lit. "special effects") is a genre of Japanese [[superhero costume|superhero]]/[[kaiju]] live action film or TV shows. It was made popular by series like [[Ultra Series|Ultraman]], [[Super Sentai]] and [[Kamen Rider]].

Often features full-body costumed actors, intense choreography, numerous action scenes, as well as considerable use of special effects. 

h4. Notable tokusatsu franchises

* [[Chouseishin Series]]
* [[Gamera (series)|]]
* [[Godzilla (series)|]]
* [[Kamen Rider]]
* [[Metal Hero]]
* [[Super Sentai]]
* [[Ultra Series]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tokusatsu":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokusatsu]

title: nipple_rings
body:
A ring-shaped [[nipple piercing]]. Use this if the piercing forms a closed loop of rigid material between both points of insertion into the skin. If it is not a complete loop, or the loop is completed by non-rigid material such as chain, it should likely be tagged as [[nipple bar]] (and possibly [[nipple jewelry]]) instead.

Sometimes depicted with something attached to it, such as [[nipple jewelry]], a [[nipple chain]], [[nipple weights]], or [[used condom]].

Do [i]not[/i] use when the rings are around the [[nipples|nipple]] and not embedded in it as a [[piercing]] would be. Use [[nipple sleeves]] in this case.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Piercings]]
* [[Tag Group:Breasts Tags]]
* [[Tag Group:Body Parts]]

title: cheating_(relationship)
body:
Cheating, in a sexual sense, is having sex with someone other than one's regular partner in a monogamous relationship. When this happens among married people, this is known as adultery. This can also apply to meeting another without the regular partner knowing.

For the act of using dishonest, unfair or banned means to win a competition or similar, see [[cheating_(competitive)|cheating (competitive)]].
h4. Example
* !post #8098370

h4. See also

title: mac_os
body:
macOS is a Unix-like operating system developed and marketed by Apple Inc. since 2001. 
It is the primary operating system for Apple's Mac computers.

title: wine_(software)
body:
A free and open-source compatibility layer that aims to allow application software and computer games developed for Microsoft Windows to run on Unix-like operating systems (especially [[Linux]] and [[mac OS|macOS]]).

h4. External links

title: debian
body:
A free and open-source [[linux|GNU/Linux]] distribution. Debian has influenced many later distributions, and had many forks.

The distro's name is a portmanteau of the creator's ([b]Ian[/b] Murdock) and his then-girlfriend's (later ex-wife) name ([b]Deb[/b]ra Lynn).

h4. See also
* [[Linux]]

h5. Forks

* [[Knoppix]]

h4. External links

title: asterios_(persona)
body: Asterios is a persona from the persona 4 arena game(s). He appears as a gigantic minotaur-like monster that is partially submerged in the ground, his head appears to be a large skull of a bull with metal attachments, chains, and partially sawed off horns that spew a reddish fire from the gouged out core. His body is mostly submerged, but appears to be a muscular humanoid that is colored black and is covered in chains that tie him to the earth, as well as having bone covered fists that he uses to beat his enemies to a pulp. Asterios is the persona of Shadow Labrys, although this fact is occasionally debated, as shadows (excluding Teddie) don't have Personas, only transformations into symbolic monsters, thus, Asterios is thought to be a mere extension of Shadow Labrys herself and symbolizes Labrys's desire for destruction.

Modeled on the story of Hachiko, a Shiba-Inu who continued to wait for his master everyday at the station long after his death, he displays exceptional intelligence and loyalty.

title: beanie
body:
A tight-fitting knitted [[hat]] traditionally designed to keep the head warm in cold weather. Common styles of wear include hugging the head with a turned-up cuff, or leaving a few inches of the top unstretched to flop or stick up. 

Some knit beanies have [[pom pom beanie|pom pom]] balls at the top, and some have [[earflap beanie|earflaps]].

Also known as a tuque.

h4. Notable characters

* [[Bito Daisukenojo]] ([[Subarashiki Kono Sekai]])
* [[Dawn (pokemon)|]] ([[Pokemon]])
* [[Zerozaki Maiori]] ([[Zaregoto Series]])

h4. See also

* [[winter clothes]]

body:

Unlike the rest of S.E.E.S, he has the ability to perceive the [[Velvet Room]] and the "Wild Card" ability to use, draw, and fuse multiple Personas.

His name is Arisato Minato in the manga, Shiomi Sakuya in the stage play adaptation, and Yuuki Makoto in the anime movie. Among fans his nickname is Kitarou, because he resembles [[Kitarou]] from [[GeGeGe no Kitarou]] in his [[hair over one eye]].

title: flame_(yu-gi-oh!_vrains)
body:

They take the form of small [[humanoid_robot|humanoid robots]] (with the ability to shapeshift at will) with prominent [[body_markings|body markings]], [[solid eyes]] along with colors matching their element.

title: chloe_von_einzbern
body:
A character who first appears in the manga [[Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma Illya]] and its anime adaptation.

She is a [[dark_skin|dark skinned]] version of [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]], and is initially referred to by the cast as "Black Illya" (黒イリヤ Kuro Illya).  As she also refers to herself as Illyasviel von Einzbern, she was later given the name "Kuro" (クロ), from "Black" (黒 Kuro), to differentiate her from the regular Illya. She herself later expanded on that name when she needed to have a full name and called herself "Chloe von Einzbern" (クロエ・フォン・アインツベルン, Kuroe is how the Japanese write Chloe). Throughout the series though she sticks to predominately using the name "Kuro" (クロ), and is referred to as such by herself and the rest of the cast.

Chloe is also a servant under the Archer designation in [[Fate/Grand Order]], wielding Kanshou and Bakuya with great skill, and later gains a Summer version [[Chloe von Einzbern (Swimsuit Avenger)|under the Avenger designation]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Hiroyama Hiroshi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Saitou Chiwa]]

h4. Costumes

* [[chloe von einzbern (beast style)|Beast Style]]
* [[chloe von einzbern (prisma klangfest)|Prisma☆Klangfest]]
* [[chloe von einzbern (type-moon racing)|Type-MOON Racing]]

title: horned_melon
body:
An oval-shaped [[fruit]] from the same family as [[cucumber]] and [[melon]], and is traditional food plant in Africa. It has horn-like spines and red to yellow color when ripe. The fruit's taste has been compared to a combination of banana and passionfruit, cucumber and zucchini, or a combination of banana, cucumber and lime.

H4. See also 
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cucumis_metuliferus]

title: cleats
body:
Spikes on the bottom of footwear designed to increase grip. Some common examples include rubber bumps for field sports and metal spikes for track running or walking across ice.

h4. See also:

[[spiked shoes]]
[[sportswear]]
[[shoes]]
[[boots]]

title: in-universe_location
body:
A recognizable location in a game, anime, or other fictional universe. 

It should be recognizable either through landmarks, architecture, terrain, and if it's the [[interior]] of a house or other structure, through floor, walls, furniture, or some other notable characteristic.

h4. Examples

* !post #8168903: [tn]Geffen, a town from [[Ragnarok Online]][/tn]
* !post #3204592: [tn]Labyrinth Zone, a level from [[Sonic the Hedgehog (classic)|]][/tn]
* !post #8426946: [tn]Neo Star Stage 1, from [[Kirby 64]][/tn]

Other examples include: towns, levels, stages, dungeons, outdoor locations or hub areas in video games; the school, or the student council room in a slice-of-life anime; the tournament arena in an action manga; etc.

h4. See also

* [[Real world location]]
* [[Screenshot background]]
* [[Scenery]]
* [[Scene reference]]

title: skyline
body:
A skyline is the outline created by a [[city]] over the horizon, usually against the background of the sky. Major real-world cities have distinctive skylines that can serve to identify a location without having to name it.

For images without cities, consider the [[horizon]] tag instead.

h4. Examples
* !post #2858671
* !post #7694841

For the vehicle, see [[Nissan Skyline]].

h4. See also

* [[cityscape]]
* [[skyscraper]]

title: saber_(type-moon_racing)_(fate)
body:
[[Saber (fate)|]] in a [[race queen]] outfit. She actually has two versions of her race queen outfit that were released as separate figures:

* "Race queen figure":https://myfigurecollection.net/item/498420, released alongside [[nero claudius (type-moon racing) (fate)|Nero Claudius]] and [[tohsaka rin (type-moon racing)|Tohsaka Rin]]. This particular outfit became an alternate costume for Saber in [[Fate/Extella Link]], called [b]Queen Saber[/b].
* "Race queen figure":https://www.goodsmile.info/en/products/slide/68135, released alongside Nero Claudius and [[jeanne d'arc (type-moon racing) (fate)|Jeanne d'Arc]]
